wp_post.post_content:
Learn Argentinian Fingerstyle Guitar

Step into the world of Zamba, where lyrical melodies intertwine with rhythmic brilliance to create a style as soulful as it is captivating. In this course, award-winning guitarist Camilo Menjura guides you through the heart of Argentinian music, revealing techniques that will transform your approach to rhythm, melody, and harmony.

Feel the pulse of 6/8 rhythms as you master intricate right-hand grooves that will bring new life to your playing. Elevate your artistry with chord-melody techniques that blend melody and harmony into a seamless, expressive performance. Whether you’re exploring the Zamba for the first time or adding its magic to your repertoire, these lessons will take your guitar skills to places you’ve never imagined.

From the rich traditions of Zamba to a taste of the dramatic Tango, this course isn’t just a journey into Argentinian music, it’s a gateway to creative freedom. By the end, you’ll not only play with more precision and depth, but you’ll also carry the soul of Argentinian music into every note you play.

Key Learning Outcomes

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

Master Traditional Rhythms

  • Play the lyrical and intricate Zamba, focusing on authentic rhythm, groove, and chord-melody techniques.
  • Explore the contrasting dynamics of Tango and other traditional Argentinian styles.

Enhance Technical Proficiency

  • Strengthen your right-hand precision through rhythmical and syncopated patterns.
  • Develop your left-hand dexterity by combining melody and harmony seamlessly.
  • Navigate the fretboard with confidence using fingerstyle-specific exercises.

Understand Musical Context

  • Gain insight into the cultural and historical roots of Argentinian guitar traditions.
  • Explore the works of legendary composers like Jorge Cafrune, Atahualpa Yupanqui, and Mercedes Sosa.

Incorporate New Inspiration

  • Absorb fresh approaches to rhythm, melody, and harmony that will enrich your playing in any genre.
  • Build a more expressive and dynamic style by integrating Argentinian techniques into your repertoire.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Immerse yourself in the rhythms of Argentinian Zamba and transform your guitar playing with intricate right-hand grooves, expressive chord-melody techniques, and the timeless beauty of traditional Argentinian music.

sample-lessons.tab_content:
Sample Lessons

[aiovg_videos template="popup" tag="221"]

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor: Camilo Menjura

Camilo grew up in Bogota. 11 years’ learning local folk by ear inspired him to study classical guitar at one of Colombia’s top music Academies. He emerged with a rich understanding of musical theory and harmony, a refreshed perspective on traditional music, and a sharp insight into how to teach his native sound to students versed in orthodox approaches to the guitar.

Now based in Britain, he’s twice won Musician of the Year at the UK Latin Awards. His work spans everything from composing film and theatre scores to appearances at the Mali Festival of the Desert and WOMAD, through to leading London’s extraordinary World Music Choir. Composer, performer, teacher: Camilo is a multi-talented, dynamic, ambassador for Colombian culture.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

Argentinian Fingerstyle Guitar

60 minutes of detailed lessons teaching you to develop a rich, expressive fingerstyle technique and master the soulful rhythms of Argentine folklore on guitar.

 

Interactive On-screen Notation

Learning new skills is easier with our innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, slow motion and more.

 

Zamba Guitar Masterclass

Take your study further with a 1 hour masterclass in the guitar styles played within the popular Argentinian style of Zamba.

rank_math_title: Argentinian Fingerstyle Guitar Course %sep% Learn Zamba & Tango Guitar Techniques
rank_math_description: Master the rhythms and textures of Argentina. Learn authentic fingerstyle techniques from zamba to tango in this deep-dive guitar course. For guitarists ready to go beyond the basics and explore the soul of South American music.

wp_post.post_content:
enrich your repertoire

Desert Blues - The Sound Of The Sahara

Imagine traveling from the Middle East into Africa. What sound would you be hearing as you encountered nomadic caravans camped at each desert oasis? Likely it would be desert blues, a music both ancient and contemporary, a guitar style that is beautifully haunted yet capable of wild, spontaneous improvisation and intense rhythmic groove.

In these remote lands, often torn apart by conflict, music brings people together: the Festival in the Desert in Northern Mali existed as the most exciting celebration of guitar-based music anywhere. Here musicians from across the world gathered to hear and learn desert blues guitar. This elemental sound blends the Tuareg musicians of the Sahel region with the mystical healing tones of the Moroccan gnawa and the African timbre found in the ancient and beautiful music of Mali, Senegal and Mauritania. Shaped by ancient civilizations, the very basis of blues and jazz, rock and trance, a sound that inspires souls to fly.

One thousand years of North African history…..plugged into an amplifier.

Key Learning Outcomes

Upon successful completion of the Desert Guitar – Origins course, participants will be able to:

  1. Demonstrate Mastery of North African Rhythms
    Apply fundamental rhythms and guitar patterns from North African and desert music traditions, including Darabuka and 6/8 rhythms.
  2. Perform Traditional Desert Blues and Sufi Music
    Execute and adapt traditional songs such as Sidi Mansour, Ighzayel Mayel, and Zahir Teneray, showcasing an understanding of rhythm and melody variations.
  3. Understand and Utilize Unique Guitar Tunings and Techniques
    Apply desert guitar tunings and techniques used by influential bands like Tinariwen, and adapt melodies to various time signatures.
  4. Explore and Appreciate Moroccan and Gnawa Music
    Gain insights into the cultural and musical significance of Moroccan Gnawa music, including its rhythmic and melodic adaptations.
  5. Integrate North African Styles into Modern Playing
    Incorporate North African guitar styles and techniques into contemporary music, enriching your playing with new flavors and rhythms.
  6. Engage with Supplementary Learning Resources
    Utilize backing tracks, ebooks, and master class recordings to deepen your understanding and practice of North African guitar styles.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Unlock a world of North African Groove and rapidly advance your guitar playing in just 30 days or your money back.

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Teacher

Justin Adams needs little introduction, he being one of Britain’s master guitarists - whether he’s Robert Plant’s right-hand man or Jah Wobble’s foil, producer of Tinariwen and Rachid Taha, a studio collaborator with the likes of Brian Eno and Sinead O’Connor, half of the JUJU duo with Gambian griot Juldeh Camara or joining Ben Mandelson and Lu Edmonds in maverick folk trio Les Triaboliques.

Adams' long connection with the music emanating from the Sahara and North Africa has ensured that he is amongst the most influential electric guitarists of the 21st Century. Just as his British forefathers Jeff Beck and Eric Clapton picked up on US blues and rockabilly to pioneer new levels of dynamic improvisation in rock guitar, Adams’ immersion in (and understanding of) the music of the Berbers and Tuareg - who roam the Sahara - and the griots of Africa has literally expanded and enriched the electric guitar’s sonic palette.

Born in London and spending his early childhood years in Egypt - his father was a diplomat - Adams grew up loving both the British pop/rock music he heard on the BBC and the North African music encountered on the streets and souks of Cairo. As a young guitarist back in Britain it was his ability to blend elements of both musical cultures that made him such a distinctive musician and an in-demand player for visionary producers and band leaders who wanted to step outside convention.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

 

Desert Guitar - Origins

Absorb the rhythms of North Africa and the Sahara then learn about the guitar approaches from Moroccan, Algerian, Tunisian, Malian and Egyptian genres in this 1 hour 40 minute course.

 

Interactive On-screen Notation

Our state of the art learning technology speeds up studying with innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, animated fretboards, variable tempos, and more today.

 

Masterclass

Receive your invitation to the next live masterclass and Q&A and gain immediate feedback and answers from Justin Adams.

 

North African Backing Tracks

Put your new techniques into practice and jam with Justin over traditional North African guitar grooves so you can develop your own authentic feel and be confident playing in a variety of new styles.

 

Sounds Of The Sahara – Ebook

Through a collection of articles by Andy Morgan learn about the different artists pioneering Saharan guitar music.

wp_post.post_content:
enrich your repertoire

Desert Blues - The Sound Of The Sahara

Imagine traveling from the Middle East into Africa. What sound would you be hearing as you encountered nomadic caravans camped at each desert oasis? Likely it would be desert blues, a music both ancient and contemporary, a guitar style that is beautifully haunted yet capable of wild, spontaneous improvisation and intense rhythmic groove.

In these remote lands, often torn apart by conflict, music brings people together: the Festival in the Desert in Northern Mali existed as the most exciting celebration of guitar-based music anywhere. Here musicians from across the world gathered to hear and learn desert blues guitar. This elemental sound blends the Tuareg musicians of the Sahel region with the mystical healing tones of the Moroccan gnawa and the African timbre found in the ancient and beautiful music of Mali, Senegal and Mauritania. Shaped by ancient civilizations, the very basis of blues and jazz, rock and trance, a sound that inspires souls to fly.

One thousand years of North African history…..plugged into an amplifier.

Key Learning Outcomes

Upon successful completion of the Desert Guitar – Origins course, participants will be able to:

  1. Demonstrate Mastery of North African Rhythms
    Apply fundamental rhythms and guitar patterns from North African and desert music traditions, including Darabuka and 6/8 rhythms.
  2. Perform Traditional Desert Blues and Sufi Music
    Execute and adapt traditional songs such as Sidi Mansour, Ighzayel Mayel, and Zahir Teneray, showcasing an understanding of rhythm and melody variations.
  3. Understand and Utilize Unique Guitar Tunings and Techniques
    Apply desert guitar tunings and techniques used by influential bands like Tinariwen, and adapt melodies to various time signatures.
  4. Explore and Appreciate Moroccan and Gnawa Music
    Gain insights into the cultural and musical significance of Moroccan Gnawa music, including its rhythmic and melodic adaptations.
  5. Integrate North African Styles into Modern Playing
    Incorporate North African guitar styles and techniques into contemporary music, enriching your playing with new flavors and rhythms.
  6. Engage with Supplementary Learning Resources
    Utilize backing tracks, ebooks, and master class recordings to deepen your understanding and practice of North African guitar styles.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Unlock a world of North African Groove and rapidly advance your guitar playing in just 30 days or your money back.

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Teacher

Justin Adams needs little introduction, he being one of Britain’s master guitarists - whether he’s Robert Plant’s right-hand man or Jah Wobble’s foil, producer of Tinariwen and Rachid Taha, a studio collaborator with the likes of Brian Eno and Sinead O’Connor, half of the JUJU duo with Gambian griot Juldeh Camara or joining Ben Mandelson and Lu Edmonds in maverick folk trio Les Triaboliques.

Adams' long connection with the music emanating from the Sahara and North Africa has ensured that he is amongst the most influential electric guitarists of the 21st Century. Just as his British forefathers Jeff Beck and Eric Clapton picked up on US blues and rockabilly to pioneer new levels of dynamic improvisation in rock guitar, Adams’ immersion in (and understanding of) the music of the Berbers and Tuareg - who roam the Sahara - and the griots of Africa has literally expanded and enriched the electric guitar’s sonic palette.

Born in London and spending his early childhood years in Egypt - his father was a diplomat - Adams grew up loving both the British pop/rock music he heard on the BBC and the North African music encountered on the streets and souks of Cairo. As a young guitarist back in Britain it was his ability to blend elements of both musical cultures that made him such a distinctive musician and an in-demand player for visionary producers and band leaders who wanted to step outside convention.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

 

Desert Guitar - Origins

Absorb the rhythms of North Africa and the Sahara then learn about the guitar approaches from Moroccan, Algerian, Tunisian, Malian and Egyptian genres in this 1 hour 40 minute course.

 

Interactive On-screen Notation

Our state of the art learning technology speeds up studying with innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, animated fretboards, variable tempos, and more today.

 

Masterclass

Receive your invitation to the next live masterclass and Q&A and gain immediate feedback and answers from Justin Adams.

 

North African Backing Tracks

Put your new techniques into practice and jam with Justin over traditional North African guitar grooves so you can develop your own authentic feel and be confident playing in a variety of new styles.

 

Sounds Of The Sahara – Ebook

Through a collection of articles by Andy Morgan learn about the different artists pioneering Saharan guitar music.

wp_post.post_content:
enrich your repertoire

Desert Blues - The Sound Of The Sahara

Imagine traveling from the Middle East into Africa. What sound would you be hearing as you encountered nomadic caravans camped at each desert oasis? Likely it would be desert blues, a music both ancient and contemporary, a guitar style that is beautifully haunted yet capable of wild, spontaneous improvisation and intense rhythmic groove.

In these remote lands, often torn apart by conflict, music brings people together: the Festival in the Desert in Northern Mali existed as the most exciting celebration of guitar-based music anywhere. Here musicians from across the world gathered to hear and learn desert blues guitar. This elemental sound blends the Tuareg musicians of the Sahel region with the mystical healing tones of the Moroccan gnawa and the African timbre found in the ancient and beautiful music of Mali, Senegal and Mauritania. Shaped by ancient civilizations, the very basis of blues and jazz, rock and trance, a sound that inspires souls to fly.

One thousand years of North African history…..plugged into an amplifier.

Key Learning Outcomes

Upon successful completion of the Desert Guitar – Origins course, participants will be able to:

  1. Demonstrate Mastery of North African Rhythms
    Apply fundamental rhythms and guitar patterns from North African and desert music traditions, including Darabuka and 6/8 rhythms.
  2. Perform Traditional Desert Blues and Sufi Music
    Execute and adapt traditional songs such as Sidi Mansour, Ighzayel Mayel, and Zahir Teneray, showcasing an understanding of rhythm and melody variations.
  3. Understand and Utilize Unique Guitar Tunings and Techniques
    Apply desert guitar tunings and techniques used by influential bands like Tinariwen, and adapt melodies to various time signatures.
  4. Explore and Appreciate Moroccan and Gnawa Music
    Gain insights into the cultural and musical significance of Moroccan Gnawa music, including its rhythmic and melodic adaptations.
  5. Integrate North African Styles into Modern Playing
    Incorporate North African guitar styles and techniques into contemporary music, enriching your playing with new flavors and rhythms.
  6. Engage with Supplementary Learning Resources
    Utilize backing tracks, ebooks, and master class recordings to deepen your understanding and practice of North African guitar styles.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Unlock a world of North African Groove and rapidly advance your guitar playing in just 30 days or your money back.

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Teacher

Justin Adams needs little introduction, he being one of Britain’s master guitarists - whether he’s Robert Plant’s right-hand man or Jah Wobble’s foil, producer of Tinariwen and Rachid Taha, a studio collaborator with the likes of Brian Eno and Sinead O’Connor, half of the JUJU duo with Gambian griot Juldeh Camara or joining Ben Mandelson and Lu Edmonds in maverick folk trio Les Triaboliques.

Adams' long connection with the music emanating from the Sahara and North Africa has ensured that he is amongst the most influential electric guitarists of the 21st Century. Just as his British forefathers Jeff Beck and Eric Clapton picked up on US blues and rockabilly to pioneer new levels of dynamic improvisation in rock guitar, Adams’ immersion in (and understanding of) the music of the Berbers and Tuareg - who roam the Sahara - and the griots of Africa has literally expanded and enriched the electric guitar’s sonic palette.

Born in London and spending his early childhood years in Egypt - his father was a diplomat - Adams grew up loving both the British pop/rock music he heard on the BBC and the North African music encountered on the streets and souks of Cairo. As a young guitarist back in Britain it was his ability to blend elements of both musical cultures that made him such a distinctive musician and an in-demand player for visionary producers and band leaders who wanted to step outside convention.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

 

Desert Guitar - Origins

Absorb the rhythms of North Africa and the Sahara then learn about the guitar approaches from Moroccan, Algerian, Tunisian, Malian and Egyptian genres in this 1 hour 40 minute course.

 

Interactive On-screen Notation

Our state of the art learning technology speeds up studying with innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, animated fretboards, variable tempos, and more today.

 

Masterclass

Receive your invitation to the next live masterclass and Q&A and gain immediate feedback and answers from Justin Adams.

 

North African Backing Tracks

Put your new techniques into practice and jam with Justin over traditional North African guitar grooves so you can develop your own authentic feel and be confident playing in a variety of new styles.

 

Sounds Of The Sahara – Ebook

Through a collection of articles by Andy Morgan learn about the different artists pioneering Saharan guitar music.

    Execute and adapt traditional songs such as Sidi Mansour, Ighzayel Mayel, and Zahir Teneray, showcasing an understanding of rhythm and melody variations.
  3. Understand and Utilize Unique Guitar Tunings and Techniques
    Apply desert guitar tunings and techniques used by influential bands like Tinariwen, and adapt melodies to various time signatures.
  4. Explore and Appreciate Moroccan and Gnawa Music
    Gain insights into the cultural and musical significance of Moroccan Gnawa music, including its rhythmic and melodic adaptations.
  5. Integrate North African Styles into Modern Playing
    Incorporate North African guitar styles and techniques into contemporary music, enriching your playing with new flavors and rhythms.
  6. Engage with Supplementary Learning Resources
    Utilize backing tracks, ebooks, and master class recordings to deepen your understanding and practice of North African guitar styles.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Unlock a world of North African Groove and rapidly advance your guitar playing in just 30 days or your money back.

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Teacher

Justin Adams needs little introduction, he being one of Britain’s master guitarists - whether he’s Robert Plant’s right-hand man or Jah Wobble’s foil, producer of Tinariwen and Rachid Taha, a studio collaborator with the likes of Brian Eno and Sinead O’Connor, half of the JUJU duo with Gambian griot Juldeh Camara or joining Ben Mandelson and Lu Edmonds in maverick folk trio Les Triaboliques.

Adams' long connection with the music emanating from the Sahara and North Africa has ensured that he is amongst the most influential electric guitarists of the 21st Century. Just as his British forefathers Jeff Beck and Eric Clapton picked up on US blues and rockabilly to pioneer new levels of dynamic improvisation in rock guitar, Adams’ immersion in (and understanding of) the music of the Berbers and Tuareg - who roam the Sahara - and the griots of Africa has literally expanded and enriched the electric guitar’s sonic palette.

Born in London and spending his early childhood years in Egypt - his father was a diplomat - Adams grew up loving both the British pop/rock music he heard on the BBC and the North African music encountered on the streets and souks of Cairo. As a young guitarist back in Britain it was his ability to blend elements of both musical cultures that made him such a distinctive musician and an in-demand player for visionary producers and band leaders who wanted to step outside convention.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

 

Desert Guitar - Origins

Absorb the rhythms of North Africa and the Sahara then learn about the guitar approaches from Moroccan, Algerian, Tunisian, Malian and Egyptian genres in this 1 hour 40 minute course.

 

Interactive On-screen Notation

Our state of the art learning technology speeds up studying with innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, animated fretboards, variable tempos, and more today.

 

Masterclass

Receive your invitation to the next live masterclass and Q&A and gain immediate feedback and answers from Justin Adams.

 

North African Backing Tracks

Put your new techniques into practice and jam with Justin over traditional North African guitar grooves so you can develop your own authentic feel and be confident playing in a variety of new styles.

 

Sounds Of The Sahara – Ebook

Through a collection of articles by Andy Morgan learn about the different artists pioneering Saharan guitar music.

wp_post.post_content:
easy to appreciate, difficult to master

The Tribal Fingerstyle Guitar

In Congo, there are 450 tribes, 450 dialects, 450 rhythms, and 450 different ways of music-making. If there’s one thing that unites them all, it’s the fingerstyle guitar technique. It uses every last inch of the fretboard to create a virtual concerto of sound. It’s an incredibly deep tradition. So deep that many tribal musical elders guard these techniques and are suspicious about sharing their wisdom with outsiders.

Complex melodic structures, syncopated rhythmical percussive playing techniques and a musical approach so different to the norm make this journey to a whole new plectrum-free zone essential study for any serious guitarist.

The True Knowledge Could Only Be Found At The Source…..
wp_post.post_excerpt: Understand complex fingerstyle guitar techniques from a naturally rhythmical African perspective and advance rapidly in just 30 days or your money back.

sample-lessons.tab_content:
Sample Lessons

[aiovg_videos template="popup" tag="126" orderby="date" limit="15" show_player_title="1"]

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor

Back in the day, Niwel Tsumbu was borrowing bits of fishing line and bike cable to build his guitars. Now he’s performed the world over with the likes of Buena Vista Social club, Natty Wailer and Baaba Maal. He’s recorded with Sinead O’Connor, Nigel Kennedy and Michael O’Suilleabhgin. He’s even written a symphony for the radical 20-piece Surge Orchestra.

From Irish folk to jazz, classical, rock and flamenco, Niwel’s story is one of cross-genre, cross-cultural exploration, improvisation, collaboration and integration. But with this session he’ll take you right back to the fundamental rhythms of his African roots in Congo. Where it all began. Niwel is a real one-off. Don’t miss the chance to benefit from learning with this master musician.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

 

Tribal Fingerstyle Guitar

Through this 1 hour 40 minute course you are guided all the way by Niwel’s patient dissection and demonstration of how all the component parts of the style slot together.

 

Interactive On-Screen Notation

Our state of the art learning technology speeds up studying with innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, animated fretboards, variable tempos, and more today.

 

Masterclass

Gain further insights into the traditional fingerstyle guitar genres of Congo by discovering more about the regional styles of music making throughout the country.

 

The Sound Of Tribal Congo

Educate yourself about Congo’s Ba’Ngala, Ba’Mongo, Ba’Luba and Kikongo tribes by learning about their background and history.

 

Songs Of The Nations

Hear Niwel’s unique Congolese world-fusion style on his 2008 solo album ‘Songs Of The Nations’ available for digital download.

rank_math_description: Learn African fingerstyle guitar via online music lessons with Niwel Tsumbu teaching the Congolese tribal approach to fingerpicking guitar.

wp_post.post_content:
easy to appreciate, difficult to master

The Tribal Fingerstyle Guitar

In Congo, there are 450 tribes, 450 dialects, 450 rhythms, and 450 different ways of music-making. If there’s one thing that unites them all, it’s the fingerstyle guitar technique. It uses every last inch of the fretboard to create a virtual concerto of sound. It’s an incredibly deep tradition. So deep that many tribal musical elders guard these techniques and are suspicious about sharing their wisdom with outsiders.

Complex melodic structures, syncopated rhythmical percussive playing techniques and a musical approach so different to the norm make this journey to a whole new plectrum-free zone essential study for any serious guitarist.

The True Knowledge Could Only Be Found At The Source…..
wp_post.post_excerpt: Understand complex fingerstyle guitar techniques from a naturally rhythmical African perspective and advance rapidly in just 30 days or your money back.

sample-lessons.tab_content:
Sample Lessons

[aiovg_videos template="popup" tag="126" orderby="date" limit="15" show_player_title="1"]

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor

Back in the day, Niwel Tsumbu was borrowing bits of fishing line and bike cable to build his guitars. Now he’s performed the world over with the likes of Buena Vista Social club, Natty Wailer and Baaba Maal. He’s recorded with Sinead O’Connor, Nigel Kennedy and Michael O’Suilleabhgin. He’s even written a symphony for the radical 20-piece Surge Orchestra.

From Irish folk to jazz, classical, rock and flamenco, Niwel’s story is one of cross-genre, cross-cultural exploration, improvisation, collaboration and integration. But with this session he’ll take you right back to the fundamental rhythms of his African roots in Congo. Where it all began. Niwel is a real one-off. Don’t miss the chance to benefit from learning with this master musician.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

 

Tribal Fingerstyle Guitar

Through this 1 hour 40 minute course you are guided all the way by Niwel’s patient dissection and demonstration of how all the component parts of the style slot together.

 

Interactive On-Screen Notation

Our state of the art learning technology speeds up studying with innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, animated fretboards, variable tempos, and more today.

 

Masterclass

Gain further insights into the traditional fingerstyle guitar genres of Congo by discovering more about the regional styles of music making throughout the country.

 

The Sound Of Tribal Congo

Educate yourself about Congo’s Ba’Ngala, Ba’Mongo, Ba’Luba and Kikongo tribes by learning about their background and history.

 

Songs Of The Nations

Hear Niwel’s unique Congolese world-fusion style on his 2008 solo album ‘Songs Of The Nations’ available for digital download.

rank_math_description: Learn African fingerstyle guitar via online music lessons with Niwel Tsumbu teaching the Congolese tribal approach to fingerpicking guitar.

wp_post.post_content:
easy to appreciate, difficult to master

The Tribal Fingerstyle Guitar

In Congo, there are 450 tribes, 450 dialects, 450 rhythms, and 450 different ways of music-making. If there’s one thing that unites them all, it’s the fingerstyle guitar technique. It uses every last inch of the fretboard to create a virtual concerto of sound. It’s an incredibly deep tradition. So deep that many tribal musical elders guard these techniques and are suspicious about sharing their wisdom with outsiders.

Complex melodic structures, syncopated rhythmical percussive playing techniques and a musical approach so different to the norm make this journey to a whole new plectrum-free zone essential study for any serious guitarist.

The True Knowledge Could Only Be Found At The Source…..
wp_post.post_excerpt: Understand complex fingerstyle guitar techniques from a naturally rhythmical African perspective and advance rapidly in just 30 days or your money back.

sample-lessons.tab_content:
Sample Lessons

[aiovg_videos template="popup" tag="126" orderby="date" limit="15" show_player_title="1"]

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor

Back in the day, Niwel Tsumbu was borrowing bits of fishing line and bike cable to build his guitars. Now he’s performed the world over with the likes of Buena Vista Social club, Natty Wailer and Baaba Maal. He’s recorded with Sinead O’Connor, Nigel Kennedy and Michael O’Suilleabhgin. He’s even written a symphony for the radical 20-piece Surge Orchestra.

From Irish folk to jazz, classical, rock and flamenco, Niwel’s story is one of cross-genre, cross-cultural exploration, improvisation, collaboration and integration. But with this session he’ll take you right back to the fundamental rhythms of his African roots in Congo. Where it all began. Niwel is a real one-off. Don’t miss the chance to benefit from learning with this master musician.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

 

Tribal Fingerstyle Guitar

Through this 1 hour 40 minute course you are guided all the way by Niwel’s patient dissection and demonstration of how all the component parts of the style slot together.

 

Interactive On-Screen Notation

Our state of the art learning technology speeds up studying with innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, animated fretboards, variable tempos, and more today.

 

Masterclass

Gain further insights into the traditional fingerstyle guitar genres of Congo by discovering more about the regional styles of music making throughout the country.

 

The Sound Of Tribal Congo

Educate yourself about Congo’s Ba’Ngala, Ba’Mongo, Ba’Luba and Kikongo tribes by learning about their background and history.

 

Songs Of The Nations

Hear Niwel’s unique Congolese world-fusion style on his 2008 solo album ‘Songs Of The Nations’ available for digital download.

rank_math_description: Learn African fingerstyle guitar via online music lessons with Niwel Tsumbu teaching the Congolese tribal approach to fingerpicking guitar.

wp_post.post_content:
easy to appreciate, difficult to master

The Tribal Fingerstyle Guitar

In Congo, there are 450 tribes, 450 dialects, 450 rhythms, and 450 different ways of music-making. If there’s one thing that unites them all, it’s the fingerstyle guitar technique. It uses every last inch of the fretboard to create a virtual concerto of sound. It’s an incredibly deep tradition. So deep that many tribal musical elders guard these techniques and are suspicious about sharing their wisdom with outsiders.

Complex melodic structures, syncopated rhythmical percussive playing techniques and a musical approach so different to the norm make this journey to a whole new plectrum-free zone essential study for any serious guitarist.

The True Knowledge Could Only Be Found At The Source…..
wp_post.post_excerpt: Understand complex fingerstyle guitar techniques from a naturally rhythmical African perspective and advance rapidly in just 30 days or your money back.

sample-lessons.tab_content:
Sample Lessons

[aiovg_videos template="popup" tag="126" orderby="date" limit="15" show_player_title="1"]

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor

Back in the day, Niwel Tsumbu was borrowing bits of fishing line and bike cable to build his guitars. Now he’s performed the world over with the likes of Buena Vista Social club, Natty Wailer and Baaba Maal. He’s recorded with Sinead O’Connor, Nigel Kennedy and Michael O’Suilleabhgin. He’s even written a symphony for the radical 20-piece Surge Orchestra.

From Irish folk to jazz, classical, rock and flamenco, Niwel’s story is one of cross-genre, cross-cultural exploration, improvisation, collaboration and integration. But with this session he’ll take you right back to the fundamental rhythms of his African roots in Congo. Where it all began. Niwel is a real one-off. Don’t miss the chance to benefit from learning with this master musician.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

 

Tribal Fingerstyle Guitar

Through this 1 hour 40 minute course you are guided all the way by Niwel’s patient dissection and demonstration of how all the component parts of the style slot together.

 

Interactive On-Screen Notation

Our state of the art learning technology speeds up studying with innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, animated fretboards, variable tempos, and more today.

 

Masterclass

Gain further insights into the traditional fingerstyle guitar genres of Congo by discovering more about the regional styles of music making throughout the country.

 

The Sound Of Tribal Congo

Educate yourself about Congo’s Ba’Ngala, Ba’Mongo, Ba’Luba and Kikongo tribes by learning about their background and history.

 

Songs Of The Nations

Hear Niwel’s unique Congolese world-fusion style on his 2008 solo album ‘Songs Of The Nations’ available for digital download.

rank_math_description: Learn African fingerstyle guitar via online music lessons with Niwel Tsumbu teaching the Congolese tribal approach to fingerpicking guitar.

wp_post.post_content:
Bring World Music To The Classroom

access a video library of

2 Minute Warm Ups & Cool Downs

A musical education of any kind can have tremendous benefits on young, developing minds. Add an international, cultural component and the positive impact is multiplied.

Different Videos For Different Ages

  • Key Stage 1
  • Lower Key Stage 2
  • Upper Key Stage 2
  • Cool Down

here’s what’s included for summer term:

Songs from Diverse Musicians Representing 9 Countries

Ready to take your students on an immersive musical journey to South America, West Africa, or the Middle East? Our curated selection of world-class tutors makes it easy for students to learn children’s songs in 8 different languages.

Being exposed to new languages lays important groundwork for continued education in world music and it also ensures that all students operate on a level field regardless of English proficiency.

In addition to the music, each lesson includes some historical or cultural information relevant to the tutor’s home country. Our current list of Summer term tutors includes:

  • Hamsa Mounif – Syria
  • Camilo Menjura – Colombia
  • Seddik Zebiri – Algeria
  • Chandra Chakraborty – India
  • Abdoulaye Samb – Senegal
  • Jana Vargová – Slovakia
  • Leo Power – Spain
  • Jalal Joyan – Afghanistan

wp_post.post_content:
capture the powerful rhythm and

Captivating Sound Of Congolese Drums

Forget the backbeat. The power of Congolese Drum Kit Rhythms will provide lifelong access to a collection of timeless beats allowing you to direct the dancefloor with ease.

You won’t just learn how to replicate a drum kit rhythm verbatim but will understand how to develop an authentic African feel and confidently work with an ensemble.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Enforce your groove with ancient African percussive elements, enhance your feel and improve your stamina in just 30 days or your money back.

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Teacher

Felix began his pro career with a group called Flash Musica, a kind of informal academy for rising Congolese stars. He was spotted by the legendary singer and bandleader Kofi Olomide, whose outfit featured some of the country’s leading virtuosos.

His musical education continued in the company of one of Congo’s greatest ever drummers, Dju Dju She (from the group Victoria Eleison). Felix re-located from Congo to Cameroon, absorbing new styles and techniques all the way, and finally settled in the UK. From here, he’s travelled across Europe, Asia and Australia in the company of some of his country’s top musicians including Kanda Bongo Man.

Now he’s resident in Liverpool, completed a degree in Popular Music and Production, and focussed on bringing his professional skills and passion for his craft to teaching and training.

wp_post.post_content:
Learn To Connect With Your Voice

Flamenco singing isn’t just about hitting the right notes. It’s about emotion, storytelling, and rhythm. The voice is the heart of flamenco, carrying centuries of history through raw, expressive melodies and intricate rhythmic phrasing. From the deep lament of Tientos to the lively energy of Bulerías, each palo has its own identity, and mastering them requires more than just technique, it demands feeling.

This course will take you inside the rich and emotive world of flamenco, breaking down essential styles like Tangos, Tientos, Bulerías, and Alegrias with step-by-step guidance. You’ll learn how to develop vocal power, precision, and rhythmic control, while also understanding the deep cultural roots that make this music so powerful.

Even if you never pursue a career in flamenco, this passionate, expressive approach to singing will transform how you perform any style of music. Learning to channel emotion, control dynamics, and connect with your voice on a deeper level will make you a more confident and compelling singer, no matter the genre. Whether you’re a vocalist looking to refine your artistry or a musician wanting to learn flamenco singing from the inside, this course led by Cádiz-born cantaora Leo Power will give you the tools to bring any song to life with true emotional depth.

Key Learning Outcomes

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

Develop a Strong Flamenco Foundation

  • Learn the rhythmic cycles and compás of flamenco.
  • Understand the structure and phrasing of different palos.
  • Strengthen vocal control, power, and expression.

Explore Essential Flamenco Styles

  • Sing letras from Tangos, Tientos, Bulerías, and Alegrias.
  • Learn to match your voice with palmas and rhythm.
  • Develop precision in phrasing, melisma, and ornamentation.

Perform with Confidence and Authenticity

  • Master the quejío, the expressive cry at the heart of flamenco singing.
  • Understand how to deliver a flamenco performance with emotional depth.
  • Apply the techniques to traditional and modern flamenco interpretations.

Gain Cultural and Historical Insight

  • Explore the history of flamenco and its evolution.
  • Understand the role of the cantaora in a traditional setting.
  • Connect with the expressive storytelling tradition behind flamenco lyrics.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Learn to connect with your voice and express emotion through passionate singing.

Sample Lessons

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor: Leo Power

Born and raised in Cádiz, Spain, Leo Power embodies the spirit of flamenco. From an early age, she immersed herself in the traditions of Andalusian music, singing and dancing at local gatherings before developing her career as a performer and educator.

Her journey has taken her far beyond the streets of Cádiz. She has blended flamenco with rock, funk, and African rhythms, forming the group Asú de Verde, and later became a cantaora and percussionist in London’s Alma Flamenco Company. Since returning to Cádiz in 2005, she has remained a dedicated performer and teacher, earning the title of Gaditana of the Year in 2017.

Leo’s teaching goes beyond technique—she shares the emotion, history, and soul of flamenco. In this course, she will guide you through the essential palos, helping you master letras, quejíos, and coletillas while deepening your understanding of flamenco’s powerful storytelling tradition.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

 

Flamenco Voice Mastery

Learn to sing flamenco from the heart with one hour of carefully planned flamenco singing lessons structured to make you competent in a variety of different styles.

 

Interactive On-screen Notation

Learning new skills is easier with our innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, virtual fretboards, slow motion and more.

 

Leo Power – Masterclass

Receive an invitation to Leo Power’s next interactive online masterclass and take your studies further under guidance from your new teacher.

 

Compás Backing Grooves

Put your new techniques into practice and jam over compás grooves so you can develop your own authentic feel and be confident playing in a variety of new styles.

rank_math_title: Learn Flamenco Singing %sep% Online Flamenco Voice Training Course
rank_math_description: Unleash your voice and learn flamenco singing. Study Tangos, Tientos, Bulerías, and Alegrias with Cádiz-born singer Leo Power. Build vocal strength, rhythm, and connection through step-by-step online flamenco voice lessons.

wp_post.post_excerpt: Master the effective way of communicating with venues and become comfortable negotiating sizable amounts of money on a regular basis so you can get your music experienced live by more people and up your earnings whilst doing what you love.

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor

At age 14, in the rural Devon countryside town of Tavistock, (UK) Edd Bateman was sitting in his bedroom playing heavy metal basslines. Suddenly his Mum arrived and said you need to go to the next-door neighbour’s house right now and take your bass amp. ‘Chimanimani’, who were a Sungura and Chimurenga dance band from Harare, Zimbabwe had just arrived in England and were there auditioning for a bass player to join their upcoming national tour. Despite Edd’s youthful inexperience and limited knowledge of theory he got the job and did the first 2 hour show just 11 days later. Within a month the band played together at African nightclubs in London, universities and then Glastonbury festival. Edd worked with Chimanimani for 6 years.

In his early 20s he took the first of many trips and tours to West Africa and instantly fell in with the famous Cissokho family of griots from Southern Senegal and began his deep training performing regular 5 hour shows with Solo Cissokho, Seckou Keita, Sadio Cissokho and the whole Dialikunda family as well as on-stage guest spots with Cheikh Lo, Orchestra Baobab and Super Diamono.

Now back in the UK and with thousands of concerts under his belt with bands from all over the world he developed his skills serving as bandleader for ‘London Astrobeat Orchestra’ and ‘Edd Bateman’s West African Love Affair’. In the lockdown he saw the need to begin documenting the brilliant African bass guitar styles he’s dedicated his life to learning and so founded the World Music Method to share this knowledge with the world.

wp_post.post_content:
Learn To Play By Ear

Music isn’t just about playing notes. It’s about hearing them before you play. The ability to listen to a song for the first time and instantly know how to fit in is what separates an average musician from a truly skilled one.

Edd Bateman has performed across the world, stepping on stage with artists he’s never met, playing songs he’s never heard, and locking in seamlessly. In Pakistan alone, he played 14 gigs with nine different artists, learning every piece on the spot. His secret? Training his ear to recognize harmony, melody, and rhythm in real time.

This course will teach you how to do the same. Combining video instruction with audio materials and interactive tests, it is designed to accelerate your ear development. Through a structured study of intervals, scales, and harmonic recognition, you will develop the ability to hear and replicate music instinctively. Whether you are a singer, guitarist, bassist or any instrumentalist, this course will sharpen your ears, strengthen your confidence, and give you the freedom to play without hesitation.

Key Learning Outcomes

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

Develop Core Listening Skills

  • Identify and distinguish between major and minor scales by ear.
  • Recognize harmonic and melodic intervals across different octaves.
  • Train your ear to follow unfamiliar chord progressions in real time.

Build Harmonic Awareness

  • Learn to recognize and differentiate between major, minor, diminished, and augmented chords.
  • Understand how seventh chords function in harmony and develop an instinct for chord substitutions.
  • Strengthen your ability to hear and internalize complex modal relationships.

Train for Real-World Musical Situations

  • Develop the ability to hear a melody and immediately play it on your instrument.
  • Follow and adapt to live performances without prior rehearsal.
  • Improve rhythmic precision and learn to anticipate phrasing in different musical contexts.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Turn your ear into a powerful tool that can confidently guide your musical journey into whichever genre it takes you in just 30 days or your money back.

_learndash_course_grid_short_description:
The ultimate goal with this course is to develop the connection between what you’re hearing in your head and your ability to rapidly replicate this on your instrument.

Through a detailed study of intervals, scales, modes and techniques to sharpen your ear you’ll get quicker at being able to hear any song for the first time and know what to play to fit in with the harmony and rhythm. You’ll develop the confidence for your ear to guide you through musical performance whilst also improving your knowledge of theory simultaneously.

This course is suitable for musicians who sing or play any instrument.

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor: Edd Bateman

At 14 years old, Edd Bateman was playing heavy metal basslines in his bedroom when his mother interrupted with an unexpected opportunity. A Zimbabwean Sungura and Chimurenga dance band, Chimanimani, had just arrived in England and needed a bass player immediately. With barely a week to prepare, Edd took the gig. Within a month, he found himself playing African nightclubs in London, university venues, and even Glastonbury Festival. He stayed with Chimanimani for six years, learning the intricacies of Zimbabwean bass firsthand.

In his early 20s, Edd’s focus shifted to West Africa, where he began intensive training with the Cissokho family of griots in Senegal. Performing marathon five-hour shows alongside Solo Cissokho, Seckou Keita, Sadio Cissokho, and the Jalikunda family, he absorbed the deep rhythmic traditions of Mbalax and Mandinka music. Guest appearances with Cheikh Lô, Orchestra Baobab, and Super Diamono solidified his reputation as a versatile and instinctive player.

With thousands of concerts to his name, Edd has led bands blending African and global styles, including London Astrobeat Orchestra and Edd Bateman’s West African Love Affair. In 2020, recognizing the lack of structured learning for African bass guitar, he founded World Music Method, an online platform dedicated to sharing the techniques and traditions of African and world music.

In 2024, Edd was called in at the last minute to tour with Sahara Desert Blues virtuoso Bombino, stepping onto the stage without rehearsal. In 2025, he expanded his musical journey to India and Pakistan, performing alongside Ustad Shafqat Ali Khan and leading members of the Sham Chaurasi Gharana. His deep foundation in African music allowed him to adapt instantly, navigating unfamiliar repertoire on the spot, a skill that defines a truly masterful bass player.

wp_post.post_content:
Perfect Your Technique Now, Not Later

Transform Your Playing with Solid Technique and Effortless Control

When I was in my early 20s, I played countless 4 or 5 hour concerts in Senegal, often with no break unless the power went out. To perform for that long without cramping or fatigue, I needed impeccable technique. It’s not about pushing harder - it’s about learning how to move efficiently, reduce tension, and play with precision (whilst also being able to communicate with the rest of the band and be comfortable to dance around the stage).

When I started the World Music Method and began teaching on Zoom, I had the unique opportunity to watch dozens of bass players at once in gallery mode. That experience was eye-opening, I saw the same common mistakes over and over again, all relating to posture and technique. I began dissecting my own approach, figuring out what I was doing right and, more importantly, how to explain it.

In recent years, I’ve been performing in Indian devotional concerts, where a single mantra can last an hour, and a set often means playing for four or five hours straight. This level of stamina isn’t about brute force - it’s about learning to eliminate unnecessary tension. When you’re sending signals from your brain to the wrong muscles - your neck, shoulders, upper arms, or forearms - it slows you down and wears you out. By switching off that tension, not only does your speed improve, but your tone becomes cleaner and more resonant.

This course is designed to give you the tools to fix these issues and elevate your playing. If you’ve ever struggled with string noise or buzz, there’s a full module dedicated to getting a clean sound. If you want to increase your stamina and refine your tone, the techniques and exercises here will get you there. Plenty of 20 minute backing tracks to work through these exercises with to take your mind out of the practice and let your body take over.

I’ve poured everything I’ve learned into this library, and I guarantee it will make a significant difference in your playing. If you don’t feel that improvement within 30 days, just let us know, and we’ll refund you in full.

Key Learning Outcomes

After completing this course, you will be able to:

Master Left and Right-Hand Techniques

  • Learn proper hand positioning to reduce strain and increase precision.
  • Develop right-hand techniques like fingerstyle, thumb strokes, and plectrum use for versatile playing.

Achieve a Clean, Professional Sound

  • Eliminate string buzz and noise with muting techniques for both hands.
  • Refine your tone through controlled pressure and efficient movement.

Enhance Dexterity and Control

  • Strengthen your fingers and build speed with targeted exercises.
  • Navigate the fretboard with ease, playing fluently in every key.

Develop Stamina and Endurance

  • Learn how to eliminate unnecessary tension for longer playing sessions without fatigue.
  • Build the strength and fluidity needed for extended performances.

Expand Your Musical Knowledge

  • Practice scales, modes, and rhythmic variations across the fretboard.
  • Train your ear to recognize intervals, rhythms, and tonal relationships.

This course is not just about improving your bass technique - it’s about giving you the tools and confidence to play better, longer, and with greater musicality.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Build stamina, improve tone and eliminate tension for effortless, professional performance.

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor: Edd Bateman

At 14 years old, Edd Bateman was playing heavy metal basslines in his bedroom when his mother interrupted with an unexpected opportunity. A Zimbabwean Sungura and Chimurenga dance band, Chimanimani, had just arrived in England and needed a bass player—immediately. With barely a week to prepare, Edd took the gig. Within a month, he found himself playing African nightclubs in London, university venues, and even Glastonbury Festival. He stayed with Chimanimani for six years, learning the intricacies of Zimbabwean bass firsthand.

In his early 20s, Edd’s focus shifted to West Africa, where he began intensive training with the Cissokho family of griots in Senegal. Performing marathon five-hour shows alongside Solo Cissokho, Seckou Keita, Sadio Cissokho, and the Jalikunda family, he absorbed the deep rhythmic traditions of Mbalax and Mandinka music. Guest appearances with Cheikh Lô, Orchestra Baobab, and Super Diamono solidified his reputation as a versatile and instinctive player.

With thousands of concerts to his name, Edd has led bands blending African and global styles, including London Astrobeat Orchestra and Edd Bateman’s West African Love Affair. In 2020, recognizing the lack of structured learning for African bass guitar, he founded World Music Method, an online platform dedicated to sharing the techniques and traditions of African and world music.

In 2024, Edd was called in at the last minute to tour with Sahara Desert Blues virtuoso Bombino, stepping onto the stage without rehearsal. In 2025, he expanded his musical journey to India and Pakistan, performing alongside Ustad Shafqat Ali Khan and leading members of the Sham Chaurasi Gharana. His deep foundation in African music allowed him to adapt instantly, navigating unfamiliar repertoire on the spot—a skill that defines a truly masterful bass player.

wp_post.post_content:
The Ultimate Guitar Training Program

Most guitarists hit a wall because they’re practicing the wrong way. If you pick up the guitar and play the same things over and over, wondering why you’re not improving, the problem isn’t your talent—it’s your technique.

Unlike classical musicians who are taught precise, efficient technique from day one, many guitarists, whether self-taught or trained develop bad habits that hold them back for years. The way you sit, hold your guitar, pick, and fret notes all determine how effortlessly you can play. If your technique isn’t right, everything feels harder than it should.

This course is not just a collection of random exercises - it’s a systematic training program designed to fix bad habits, strengthen technique, and develop complete control over your instrument. Led by three world-class guitarists; Niwel Tsumbu, Fernando Perez, and Camilo Menjura, this course takes you through the exact exercises they used to build their precision, dexterity, and fluidity. You’ll train your hands, mind, and muscle memory to play cleaner, faster, and with total confidence.

It’s not about inspiration. It’s about results.

Whether you’re working on speed, fluidity, stamina, or fretboard navigation, this course gives you the tools to build bulletproof technique, step by step.

Press play, put in the work, and transform your playing.

Key Learning Outcomes

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

Build Effortless Technique

  • Develop efficient, strain-free hand movement for long-term ease and speed.
  • Train both hands for coordination, accuracy, and independence.
  • Eliminate unnecessary tension and bad habits that slow you down.

Navigate the Fretboard with Confidence

  • Learn to move fluidly across the neck, unlocking freedom in any key.
  • Master scale and chord shapes that make finding notes effortless.
  • Develop a clear, structured roadmap for fretboard navigation.

Strengthen Your Picking & Fingerstyle Precision

  • Train both pick and fingerstyle techniques for ultimate control.
  • Learn advanced picking patterns, alternate picking, and articulation drills.
  • Improve finger independence and right-hand attack for clarity and speed.

Expand Your Dexterity & Strength

  • Master fretboard workouts used by top players to build control and endurance.
  • Train left-hand strength for smoother, more fluid playing.
  • Develop precision through structured warm-ups and coordination drills.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Build bulletproof technique with a structured training system designed to eliminate bad habits and transform your playing

_learndash_course_grid_short_description:
Do you play the same thing every time you pick up the guitar and wonder why you’re not improving? If you spend much of your practice time playing things you already know then you are not challenging yourself.

This course combines almost 100 years of guitar expertise from award winning musicians Niwel Tsumbu, Fernando Perez and Camilo Menjura. Despite all being excellent virtuosos, one major thing these three guitarists have in common is perfect technique. Follow their guidance, fix your bad habits and receive continuous predictable improvement with guaranteed results.

This course combines almost 100 years of guitar expertise from award winning musicians Niwel Tsumbu, Fernando Perez and Camilo Menjura. Despite all being excellent virtuosos, one major thing these three guitarists have in common is perfect technique. Sample Lessons

[aiovg_videos template="popup" tag="249"]

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutors

This course brings together almost 100 years of combined guitar expertise from three of the most technically accomplished musicians:

Niwel Tsumbu
A virtuoso guitarist with an effortless, fluid approach to technique, Niwel has mastered everything from Congolese Sebene to jazz improvisation, flamenco, and contemporary fingerstyle. His ability to move across the fretboard with absolute ease comes from a deep understanding of technique, which he shares in this course through his personal warm-up exercises and dexterity drills.

Fernando Perez
A master of global guitar traditions, Fernando has spent decades studying, performing, and teaching everything from flamenco and Indian slide guitar to jazz and classical techniques. His technical fluency is unmatched, and his structured approach to scales, picking techniques, and fretboard mapping will transform the way you approach your instrument.

Camilo Menjura
With a background in classical and Latin American folk guitar, Camilo brings a precise, disciplined approach to technique. His focus on chord inversions, right-hand independence, and harmonic movement helps guitarists develop control, fluidity, and musicality in their playing.

Together, these three world-class players offer a comprehensive training system to fix bad habits, improve efficiency, and develop elite-level technique—no matter your style.

wp_post.post_content:
Play with the World’s Finest Musicians

A great musician is shaped by the company they keep. If you want to develop groove, confidence, and endurance, you need to play with great musicians. The Backing Track Directory gives you direct access to an expansive library of professionally recorded backing tracks featuring master musicians from across the globe. Whether you play guitar, bass, drums, keys, horns, or any other instrument, this is your opportunity to train in real-world musical settings.

These aren’t generic play-alongs. Many tracks feature adjustable mixes, allowing you to mute or isolate instruments to refine your skills. Whether you’re comping over Latin rhythms, locking into African grooves, or improvising over Indian ragas, this resource helps you internalize the feel, phrasing, and interaction of live performance.

Use these tracks to develop your improvisation, rhythm, and ensemble awareness, the best way to grow as a musician is by playing, so step in and take the stage.

Key Learning Outcomes

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

Expand Your Musical Versatility

  • Play alongside authentic recordings in a diverse range of global styles.
  • Develop an intuitive sense of rhythm and groove across different musical traditions.
  • Improve timing, phrasing, and ensemble awareness by practicing with world-class musicians.

Train for Live Performance

  • Gain stamina and endurance by playing extended live-style backing tracks.
  • Adapt your playing to different instrumentation and arrangements.
  • Learn to lock in with percussion, basslines, and harmonic instruments like you would on stage.

Refine Your Musicianship

  • Strengthen improvisational skills in real-world musical settings.
  • Internalize complex rhythmic patterns, including polyrhythms and syncopation.
  • Train your ear and responsiveness by playing in diverse global styles.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Get stage confident jamming over a variety of world grooves with world class musicians and get yourself prepared for any live experience in just 30 days or your money back.

_learndash_course_grid_short_description:
From Soukous to Samba & Salsa, Bolero to Bossa Nova, Mbalax to Maskandi and more. Make your practice time more enjoyable and get inspired to develop your live performing stamina and confidence.

Play with great musicians and you’ll naturally develop fast. The backing track directory recordings feature the World Music Method tutors and connected musicians. Many tracks have options for different mixes allowing you to choose which instruments to play along with or even experiment creating your own musical lines over.

Many tracks have options for different mixes allowing you to choose which instruments to play along with or even experiment creating your own musical lines over.

wp_post.post_content:
Master the Rhythms of the World

Rhythm is the foundation of all music, shaping the energy and movement of every genre. From the driving pulse of West African Mbalax to the hypnotic cycles of Indian tabla, from the fiery Flamenco compás to the rolling groove of Cuban Son, every culture has developed its own rhythmic identity. To truly master music, you need to go beyond your instrument and internalize the global language of rhythm.

The World Rhythms Encyclopedia is not just a collection of beats—it’s a deep dive into the rhythmic DNA of dozens of musical traditions. Whether you’re a percussionist, guitarist, bassist, pianist, or any musician looking to expand your rhythmic fluency, this course will train your ear, improve your groove, and give you the tools to adapt to any musical setting.

With detailed breakdowns of essential rhythms from Africa, Latin America, the Middle East, South Asia, and beyond, you’ll develop a stronger rhythmic foundation, better time feel, and a broader musical perspective. Play along, feel the pulse, and transform the way you hear and create music.

Key Learning Outcomes

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

Develop a Deep Understanding of Global Rhythms

  • Recognize and analyze rhythmic patterns from Africa, Latin America, the Middle East, India, and beyond.
  • Identify key time signatures, polyrhythms, and syncopations unique to each tradition.

Expand Your Musical Versatility

  • Adapt diverse rhythmic approaches to your own instrument, whether you play drums, guitar, bass, or another instrument.
  • Apply new grooves and rhythmic techniques to enhance your improvisation and composition skills.

Train Your Internal Sense of Rhythm

  • Improve your timing, coordination, and ability to lock into complex rhythms.
  • Strengthen your ability to feel and play different subdivisions and cross-rhythms naturally.

Bridge Traditional and Modern Styles

  • Understand how folkloric rhythms have influenced contemporary genres, from jazz and rock to electronic and world fusion.
  • Incorporate elements of world rhythms into your playing to create fresh and dynamic musical textures.

This course is designed to develop rhythmic fluency across cultures, making you a more well-rounded and rhythmically confident musician, no matter your instrument.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Accelerate your rhythmical skills in a fun and exciting way with bitesize playalong lessons exploring rhythms from throughout the world in just 30 days or your money back.

_learndash_course_grid_short_description:
All over the world different cultures use rhythm as a form of expression. If you can stretch your musicality to understand a multitude of varied grooves, time signatures and approaches then you can use your heightened knowledge of rhythm to feel confident and free playing in any genre.

This isn’t a percussion lesson but instead a tool to make you more rhythmically advanced. You don’t need any specific percussion instrument to use this course. Drum along on a table, your lap or any instrument you may have at home.

wp_post.post_content:
Instant Progress. No Filler. No Wasted Time

Every guitarist hits a plateau. You pick up the guitar, play what you already know, and wonder why you’re not improving. The problem isn’t time, it’s focus.

This course cuts through the noise. 100 fast, effective exercises designed to sharpen your technique, expand your fretboard knowledge, and refine your coordination. Each tip is under a minute, but the impact is long-lasting. These are the exact drills Niwel Tsumbu uses to stay in top form, the same techniques that have kept his playing sharp enough for Grammy-winning recordings.

From classical precision to rhythmic agility, from counterpoint to fluid finger dexterity, this course gives you the tools to play cleaner, faster, and more expressively. Press play, put in the work, and watch your playing transform.

Key Learning Outcomes

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

Develop Finger Strength & Dexterity

  • Master right-hand agility exercises for precision and speed.
  • Strengthen left-hand coordination to improve fluid movement across the fretboard.
  • Increase finger independence with targeted exercises used by professional guitarists.

Expand Your Fretboard Knowledge

  • Learn interval-based exercises to unlock new note choices.
  • Train in counterpoint, canons, and harmonic movement to deepen your understanding of melody and harmony.
  • Apply classical and African ornamentation techniques to add color and variation to your playing.

Enhance Rhythmic Precision

  • Develop metronomic accuracy with rhythmic stamina drills.
  • Work on syncopation and complex subdivisions to improve groove and feel.
  • Strengthen coordination between both hands with structured timing exercises.

Master Picking & Fingerstyle Techniques

  • Improve alternate picking speed and control.
  • Develop classical fingerstyle agility with intricate right-hand patterns.
  • Learn hybrid picking for smoother transitions between melody and chords.

Refine Articulation & Expression

  • Practice expressive phrasing techniques including slides, hammer-ons, and pull-offs.
  • Learn techniques to improve note sustain and dynamic control.
  • Train your hands to navigate the fretboard with confidence and precision.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Practice with purpose. Progress with precision.

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor: Niwel Tsumbu

Niwel Tsumbu’s journey began in the Democratic Republic of Congo, where he crafted his first guitars using fishing line and bicycle cables. From those early days, he developed into one of the most sought-after and versatile guitarists of his generation, blending his deep roots in Congolese music with jazz, classical, and global influences.

His career has taken him across the world, performing with artists such as Buena Vista Social Club, Baaba Maal, and Natty Wailer, and collaborating with Sinéad O’Connor, Nigel Kennedy, and Michael O’Suilleabháin. More recently, Niwel played on Rhiannon Giddens’ Grammy-winning album and has toured extensively with her and Taj Mahal across the US and Canada. His latest album, Milimo, showcases his ability to bridge African tradition with contemporary expression, further cementing his reputation as a truly innovative musician.

Despite his genre-spanning career, Niwel remains deeply connected to his roots in Sebene, Soukous, and Rumba. In this course, he brings decades of experience back to where it all started—teaching the fundamental rhythms, phrasing, and techniques that define Congolese guitar.

wp_post.post_content:
An Immersive Guide to Syrian Vocal Heritage and Expression

Syrian Vocal Mastery is a unique opportunity to explore the rich traditions of Arabic singing while developing your voice with structured, professional training. Designed for singers of all levels who wish to deepen their understanding of Middle Eastern vocal music, this course combines technical development with cultural context, ensuring you not only sing the notes, but embody their meaning.

Through step-by-step lessons, you will learn essential warm-ups, discover the depth of Arabic scales and maqams, and develop expressive techniques that bring emotion and authenticity to your performance. Along the way, you will explore the rhythmic foundations of Arabic music, study traditional songs, and learn how to improvise within the maqam system.

This course is both practical and immersive. Each module is designed to strengthen your technique, broaden your musical awareness, and give you the tools to perform confidently. By the end, you will have the technical control, cultural insight, and artistic expression needed to sing with both precision and soul.

Key Learning Outcomes

Upon Successful Completion of this course, participants will understand:

Vocal Technique & Warm-ups

  • Apply effective warm-up routines to prepare your voice safely and effectively.
  • Strengthen breath control, tone, and clarity through structured exercises.

Arabic Scales & Maqams

  • Recognize and sing core Arabic scales.
  • Navigate the maqam system with confidence and accuracy.
  • Understand the cultural significance of maqams in Arabic music.

Expression & Rhythm

  • Capture the unique expressive qualities of Arabic vocal performance.
  • Integrate essential Arabic rhythmic cycles into your singing.

Repertoire & Improvisation

  • Perform traditional Arabic songs with authenticity and nuance.
  • Develop improvisational skills within the maqam framework.
  • Combine technique, rhythm, and expression into original interpretations.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Discover the rich tradition of Syrian vocal artistry. This course guides you through technique, style, and expression to help you unlock the power of your voice.

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor

Hamsa Mounif is a professional Oriental singer whose voice has captivated audiences across the Middle East and Europe. A graduate of the Higher Institute of Music in Damascus, Syria, and holder of a Master’s degree in Music Performance from the University of East London, Hamsa brings both academic depth and lived experience to her teaching.

Her career spans major stages and collaborations: from The Voice Arabia to the National Orchestra of Syria, from Glastonbury and WOMAD to the Royal Festival Hall. She has performed alongside artists such as Damon Albarn, Paul Weller, Faia Younan, Seckou Keita, and Bassekou Kouyaté, while continuing to share Syrian musical heritage with new audiences.

Now based in the UK, Hamsa continues to perform internationally and develop her solo projects, while also dedicating her energy to teaching. Her approach combines technical training with cultural storytelling, helping students unlock not only their voices but also the emotional power behind the music.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

 

Syrian Vocal Mastery

Structured lessons to guide you through the foundations of Arabic singing, from breathing techniques and vocal warm-ups to mastering quartertones and maqamat.

Interactive On-Screen Notation

Learning new skills is easier with our innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, looping, slow motion and more.

wp_post.post_content:
Master The Flamenco Cajón

Uncover the heartbeat of Flamenco with internationally acclaimed percussionist Malick Mbengue.

Born and raised in Cádiz, the cradle of Flamenco, Malick Mbengue brings an unmatched depth of knowledge and passion to this course. In Flamenco Cajón Rhythms, you’ll master the essential rhythms of Flamenco, exploring its vibrant palos such as Bulerías, Tanguillos, Soleá, and Seguiriya, while honing advanced techniques like ghost notes, rudiments, and dynamic control.

This course not only teaches you to play the cajón but also immerses you in the cultural and historical significance of Flamenco. With a structured progression, you’ll learn to adapt your skills across tempos and styles, culminating in a comprehensive understanding of Flamenco’s intricate rhythmic structures.

Whether you’re a percussionist seeking to broaden your horizons or a Flamenco enthusiast eager to deepen your connection to this art form, Flamenco Cajón Rhythms provides an authentic and inspiring journey into one of Spain’s most iconic musical traditions.

Key Learning Outcomes

By the end of the Flamenco Cajón Rhythms course, you will:

Master Flamenco Rhythms

  • Play essential palos like Bulerías, Soleá, Tanguillos, and Seguiriya with precision and confidence.
  • Understand the 12-beat compás and its variations across different styles.

Refine Cajón Techniques

  • Develop advanced skills, including ghost notes, flams, and rudiments.
  • Build speed, stamina, and dynamic control for professional-level performance.

Perform with Authenticity

  • Adapt your playing to different tempos and styles, maintaining the expressive nuances of Flamenco.
  • Collaborate effectively in an ensemble setting, integrating cajón rhythms with guitars, vocals, and dance.

Understand the Cultural Context

  • Gain insights into Flamenco’s rich history and evolution, from its Andalusian roots to its modern forms.
  • Explore the contributions of legendary artists and the integration of the cajón into Flamenco.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Learn advanced cajón techniques while mastering essential Flamenco palos in an authentic journey through Andalusian traditions.

Sample Lessons

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor: Malick Mbengue

Malick Mbengue is a professional percussionist, author, and educator from Cádiz, Spain, a city renowned as the birthplace of Flamenco. With mixed Spanish/Senegalese heritage and a lifelong immersion in Andalusian music, Malick embodies the fusion of cultures that defines his artistry.

He began playing the cajón and djembe at the age of seven, performing in local Flamenco bands by the age of 12. Malick later refined his skills through formal studies in percussion and classical music at the Manuel de Falla Conservatory of Music in Cádiz and jazz at the Escuela de Música Moderna de la UCA. His technique blends the rhythmic traditions of Flamenco, African, and Latin music with the improvisational freedom of jazz, creating a unique and versatile style.

Malick has collaborated with celebrated Flamenco artists such as David Palomar, Carmen Ledezma, and Mercedes Ruiz, as well as international jazz legends like Jerry González and Chano Domínguez. His global performances have taken him to prestigious venues such as London’s Ronnie Scott’s and the Love Supreme Festival.

In addition to performing, Malick has shared his expertise through masterclasses, seminars, and his published work on Flamenco percussion. A passionate educator, he continues to inspire students with his deep understanding of rhythm, culture, and the art of Flamenco.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

 

Flamenco Cajón Rhythms

Master the art of flamenco cajón with Malick Mbengue’s online course, designed to seamlessly blend continuous technique refinement with building confidence and skill in the essential flamenco palos (styles): Tangos, Bulerías, Soleá, Tanguillos, and Seguiriyas.

 

Interactive On-screen Notation

Learning new skills is easier with our innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, virtual fretboards, slow motion and more.

 

Masterclass

Receive an invitation to Malick Mbengue’s next interactive online masterclass and take your studies further under guidance from your new teacher.

 

Compás Backing Grooves

Put your new techniques into practice and jam over compás grooves so you can develop your own authentic feel and be confident playing in a variety of new styles.

rank_math_description: Learn flamenco cajón rhythms with internationally acclaimed musician Malick Mbengue and improve your technique the Andalusian way.

wp_post.post_content:
Take Your Guitar Playing Beyond The Ordinary

Flamenco is one of the most demanding and expressive forms of guitar playing. Have you ever watched a flamenco guitarist effortlessly follow a singer, anticipating every shift in melody, somehow knowing exactly which chord to play next even when the progression is improvised? They drive the rhythm while weaving intricate lines, navigating time signatures that seem to stretch and contract with an extra beat appearing out of nowhere.

How do they do that?

Under the expert guidance of Fernando Perez, you’ll break down the essential elements of flamenco and learn to apply them in a real musical setting. This course focuses on four core palos: Tangos, Soleá, Alegrías, and Bulerías, taught in the most practical way possible. Rather than just memorizing licks, you’ll be training alongside a flamenco singer (cantaor) and cajón player, learning how to accompany, respond, and perform within the true dynamic of live flamenco.

From mastering rasgueados, abanicos, golpes, and falsetas to developing a deep understanding of flamenco’s rhythmic cycles, this course will prepare you to play with confidence, whether solo or in an ensemble. This is more than just learning technique. It’s about fluency, expression, and the ability to truly feel the music.

Key Learning Outcomes

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

Master Fundamental Flamenco Techniques

  • Develop essential right-hand techniques including rasgueados, abanicos, and alzapua.
  • Improve left-hand articulation for fluid, expressive playing.
  • Understand flamenco phrasing, timing, and compás for different palos.

Learn the Art of Accompaniment

  • Accompany a cantaor (flamenco singer) and a percussionist with confidence.
  • Learn how to provide rhythmically solid and expressive backing for dancers.
  • Master cierres and remates to cue transitions seamlessly.

Expand Your Musical Vocabulary

  • Learn traditional and modern falsetas from the styles of Paco de Lucía and Tomatito.
  • Develop the ability to improvise within the flamenco framework.
  • Understand the harmonic and rhythmic structure of each palo.

Build Confidence in Performance

  • Play full pieces in Tangos, Soleá, Alegrías, and Bulerías with authentic phrasing.
  • Develop an instinctive feel for compás and rhythmic variations.
  • Perform with the precision and intensity required for flamenco.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Develop a solid understanding of essential flamenco genres and learn the guitar skills needed to confidently perform Flamenco live and accompany singers and dancers or your money back.
