tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor: Fernando Perez

Fernando Perez is a master guitarist known for his expertise in global guitar styles, having studied and performed in flamenco’s homeland of Andalusia. With an extensive career that spans continents, Fernando has dedicated years to deeply understanding the flamenco tradition, working alongside respected flamenco musicians, and refining his approach to the instrument.

What makes Fernando’s approach truly unique is his ability to bring the depth of flamenco technique into a structured and accessible learning experience. He has toured the world, performed in prestigious venues, and published educational materials that help bridge the gap between different musical traditions.

Fernando’s teaching philosophy is rooted in authenticity. He ensures that students not only learn how to play flamenco but also understand its cultural significance, develop the ability to accompany other musicians, and gain the confidence to perform with genuine expression.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

 

Ultimate Flamenco Guitar - Deluxe

5 hours of detailed lessons teaching you to be proficient in the essential techniques and palos of flamenco including Tangos, Solea, Alegrias and Bulerias whilst developing an understanding of how to accompany a singer.

 

Interactive On-Screen Notation

Learning new skills is easier with our innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, virtual fretboards, slow motion and more.

 

Bulerias Masterclass

Engage in some additional study watching Fernando explain the concepts of Bulerias further during this masterclass.

 

Flamenco Ear Training

Learn to recognise the scales and modes by ear and further your understanding of the distinct differences between Flamenco's unique guitar techniques.

 

   Compás Backing Grooves

Play-along at different tempos with some of the rhythms you've been learning during the course.

wp_post.post_content:
Master Turkish Makams On Guitar

Forget scales. Replace your Western music theory with the deep, expressive world of Eastern makams. Turkish music offers a radically different way of hearing and structuring melody—one that will rewire your understanding of phrasing, ornamentation, and improvisation.

In this course, you’ll develop a heightened harmonic awareness by learning how to hear, define, and apply microtonal nuances. Fernando Pérez has spent years experimenting with different instruments and tuning systems to perform traditional Turkish music. Now, he has refined a method to play makams on a standard 6-string guitar by retuning a single string to a microtone—eliminating the need for extra frets or specialized instruments.

From the hypnotic sway of Hicaz Sirto to the deeply emotive Çanakkale Türküsü, this course will take you on an immersive journey into the heart of Turkish makam music. By the end, your playing will feel more expressive, your phrasing more fluid, and your ability to navigate new musical landscapes limitless.

Key Learning Outcomes

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

Master the Turkish Makam System

  • Understand the core principles of makam-based melody construction.
  • Recognize microtonal intervals and apply them to your guitar playing.
  • Develop an instinctive feel for traditional Turkish phrasing.

Expand Your Rhythmic Vocabulary

  • Learn Turkish aksak (asymmetrical) rhythms such as 9/8 and 6/8.
  • Develop fluid right-hand techniques suited for intricate rhythmic phrasing.
  • Syncopate and emphasize beats in an authentic way.

Adapt Traditional Turkish Techniques to Guitar

  • Transfer the ornamentation techniques of the oud onto the guitar.
  • Master advanced slides, bends, and vibrato for authentic Turkish expression.
  • Apply Turkish melodic phrasing to your own compositions and improvisations.

Perform Iconic Turkish Pieces

  • Play fully realized arrangements of Kirklah Semahi, Yali Kenari, Hicaz Sirto, and more.
  • Study detailed transcriptions with correct finger placement and articulation.
  • Interpret traditional pieces with nuance and stylistic accuracy.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Forget scales. Replace your Western music theory with the knowledge of ancient Eastern makams.

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor: Fernando Perez

Fernando Perez is not just a guitarist—he’s a musical explorer. From flamenco to Indian classical music, from Chinese pipa techniques to Arabic maqam traditions, he has spent a lifetime studying global stringed instruments and translating their sounds onto the guitar.

Having trained in Istanbul, Fernando developed a deep understanding of the Turkish makam system, learning directly from master musicians. His expertise in microtonal tuning and traditional phrasing makes him uniquely qualified to teach guitarists how to step beyond Western tuning and scale systems.

Fernando has performed worldwide, recorded more than 20 albums, and contributed to Grammy-winning productions. His teaching is clear, structured, and designed for guitarists who want to push beyond familiar musical territory and develop a richer, more nuanced voice on the instrument.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

 

Turkish Music For Guitar

By re-tuning your ears, your guitar and your mind into the Turkish makam system you’ll develop a heightened harmonic awareness and knowledge about how to transpose the traditional techniques of the oud on to your guitar during this 1.5 hour course.

 

Interactive On-screen Notation

Our state of the art learning technology speeds up studying with innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, animated fretboards, variable tempos, and more today.

 

Masterclass

Go deeper into the philosophy of the Turkish makam and learn how to appreciate Eastern music by watching the next 1 hour masterclass live or streaming the recording.

rank_math_title: Learn Turkish Guitar Techniques %sep% Makam music for guitar
rank_math_description: Learn how to play Turkish makam music on a standard 6-string guitar via online Turkish music lessons with notation and tab by Fernando Perez.

wp_post.post_content:
master the art of

Authentic Cuban Bass Playing

Step into the beating heart of Havana’s musical soul, where rhythm is not just a feature but the foundation. This course is your gateway to mastering Tumbao, the driving force of Cuban bass pioneered by Israel "Cachao" López. But this isn’t just about technique. It is about language, lineage, and legacy.

Guided by celebrated bassist Rubén Ramos Medina, you will go far beyond surface-level grooves. You will build a deep understanding of styles like Son Montuno, Cha Cha Cha, Bolero, and Latin Jazz, each explored through authentic patterns, rhythmic fluency, and historical insight. You will develop versatility not just as a bass player, but as a musician rooted in one of the world’s richest rhythmic traditions.

From clave variations to ensemble interaction, from historical progressions to modern jazz interpretations, this course is designed for serious bassists ready to evolve.

Whether you are expanding your rhythmic palette or seeking mastery in Latin music, Tumbao – Cuban Bass Evolution delivers a comprehensive and transformative learning experience.

Key Learning Outcomes

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

Foundations of Cuban Rhythm

  • Understand the origin and function of Tumbao in Latin music
  • Internalize the 3:2 and 2:3 clave forms, including rumba and 6/8 variations
  • Build fluency in phrasing over clave patterns

Stylistic Development

  • Master the essential patterns and chord progressions of Son Montuno, Cha Cha Cha, Bolero, and Salsa
  • Learn how to construct bass lines that drive groove while supporting harmony
  • Explore minor and major II–V–I progressions in Latin styles

Ensemble Interaction

  • Apply techniques in full-band contexts with real-world performance examples
  • Develop rhythmic lock with percussion and understand the role of conga and timbales
  • Practice with Latin ensemble backing tracks across a range of traditional and modern feels

Advanced Concepts and Jazz Fusion

  • Adapt clave-based bass lines to Latin Jazz compositions
  • Study bass roles in iconic Latin Jazz tracks and analyze phrasing over funk-influenced salsa grooves
  • Apply the Latin cycle of fourths and hybrid rhythmic concepts

Cultural and Historical Context

  • Trace the evolution of Cuban bass from traditional roots to modern fusion
  • Understand the impact of Cuban music across Latin America and its global influence
wp_post.post_excerpt: Immerse yourself in the comprehensive curriculum of Cuban bass styles and understand the true essence of the Tumbao by learning about it’s connection to the clave and ensemble.

sample-lessons.tab_content:
Sample Lessons

[aiovg_videos template="popup" tag="127" orderby="date" limit=""]

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor: Rubén Ramos Medina

Rubén Ramos Medina, originally from Colon City, Panama, began his musical journey in percussion before embracing the bass guitar at the age of 13. Graduating from the Interamerican University in San Juan, Puerto Rico, his musical pursuits catapulted him to collaborate with renowned artists like Carlos Garnett and Danilo Pérez. Equipped with a Major in Music, Ruben ventured into the realm of bass improvisation, eawinning awards at global festivals like Master-Jam Festival in Odessa, Ukraine.

His musical voyage spans performances with illustrious names, from Carnival Cruise Lines to London’s Moulin Rouge musical, showcasing his versatility across Latin American rhythms and jazz improvisation. From jam sessions with Billy Cobham to enthralling audiences alongside Cuban icons like Compay Segundo, Rubén has etched his name as an acclaimed bassist and composer, celebrated for his diverse musical expertise and innovative artistry.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

 

Tumbao – Cuban Bass Evolution

Become fluent in Cuban bass with a carefully constructed curriculum guided by Ruben Ramos taking you beyond Son and Salsa and into Bolero and Cha-cha-cha.

 

Interactive On-screen Notation

Learning new skills is easier with our innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, virtual fretboards, slow motion and more.

 

Cuban Rhythms Masterclass

Take your Cuban musical study even further with a 1 hour rhythm masterclass led by percussionist Ernesto Marichales.

 

Latin Rhythms Encyclopedia

Discover how percussion ensembles work together by understanding the individual parts played by each instrument.

 

Latin American Backing Tracks

Put your new techniques into practice and jam over Salsa, Bolero, Cha Cha Cha and more so you can develop your own authentic feel and be confident playing in a variety of new styles.

wp_post.post_content:
Take Your Guitar Playing Beyond the Ordinary

In Congo, there are 450 tribes, 450 dialects, and 450 unique approaches to music. At the heart of these traditions is an extraordinary fingerstyle guitar technique that transforms the instrument into an entire ensemble. Every inch of the fretboard is used, creating cascading melodies, intricate rhythms, and a depth of sound unlike anything else.

This style is deeply rooted in tribal knowledge, often guarded by musical elders who see it as a sacred tradition. The complex melodic structures, syncopated rhythmic phrasing, and percussive techniques make this one of the most challenging and rewarding guitar traditions to master.

Niwel Tsumbu is one of the few musicians who has dedicated his life to understanding and sharing these techniques. In this course, he breaks down the mechanics of tribal fingerstyle guitar, making it accessible for players who want to push their technique beyond the ordinary. Whether you are a fingerstyle player looking to expand your approach or a plectrum-based guitarist seeking new inspiration, this course will change the way you see the guitar.

Key Learning Outcomes

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

Master Tribal Fingerstyle Guitar Techniques

  • Develop a plectrum-free approach that uses all five fingers of the right hand.
  • Build independence between basslines, melody, and rhythm within a single performance.
  • Learn syncopated and percussive right-hand techniques unique to Congolese guitar.

Expand Your Melodic and Harmonic Understanding

  • Understand African intervallic movement, including 3rds, 6ths, and 9ths in Congolese music.
  • Explore the harmonic and melodic framework of different tribal guitar traditions.
  • Apply African chord-melody techniques to create intricate solo arrangements.

Deepen Your Rhythmic Awareness

  • Learn complex African time-feels, polyrhythms, and cross-rhythms.
  • Study how traditional Ba Kongo and Ba Ngala grooves function in an ensemble.
  • Develop the ability to lock into African rhythmic cycles naturally.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Understand complex fingerstyle guitar techniques from a naturally rhythmical African perspective and advance rapidly in just 30 days or your money back.

sample-lessons.tab_content:
Sample Lessons

[aiovg_videos template="popup" tag="126" orderby="date" limit="15" show_player_title="1"]

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor: Niwel Tsumbu

Niwel Tsumbu’s journey began in the Democratic Republic of Congo, where he crafted his first guitars using fishing line and bicycle cables. From those early days, he developed into one of the most sought-after and versatile guitarists of his generation, blending his deep roots in Congolese music with jazz, classical, and global influences.

His career has taken him across the world, performing with artists such as Buena Vista Social Club, Baaba Maal, and Natty Wailer, and collaborating with Sinéad O’Connor, Nigel Kennedy, and Michael O’Suilleabháin. More recently, Niwel played on Rhiannon Giddens’ Grammy-winning album and has toured extensively with her and Taj Mahal across the US and Canada. His latest album, Milimo, showcases his ability to bridge African tradition with contemporary expression, further cementing his reputation as a truly innovative musician.

Despite his genre-spanning career, Niwel remains deeply connected to his roots in Sebene, Soukous, and Rumba. In this course, he brings decades of experience back to where it all started—teaching the fundamental rhythms, phrasing, and techniques that define Congolese guitar.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

 

Tribal Fingerstyle Guitar

Through this 1 hour 40 minute course you are guided all the way by Niwel’s patient dissection and demonstration of how all the component parts of the style slot together.

 

Interactive On-Screen Notation

Our state of the art learning technology speeds up studying with innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, animated fretboards, variable tempos, and more today.

 

Masterclass

Gain further insights into the traditional fingerstyle guitar genres of Congo by discovering more about the regional styles of music making throughout the country.

 

The Sound Of Tribal Congo

Educate yourself about Congo’s Ba’Ngala, Ba’Mongo, Ba’Luba and Kikongo tribes by learning about their background and history.

 

Songs Of The Nations

Hear Niwel’s unique Congolese world-fusion style on his 2008 solo album ‘Songs Of The Nations’ available for digital download.

rank_math_description: Learn African fingerstyle guitar via online music lessons with Niwel Tsumbu teaching the Congolese tribal approach to fingerpicking guitar.

wp_post.post_excerpt: Gain a comprehensive understanding of traditional bass guitar styles from South Africa, Nigeria, Congo and become a better bassist by developing a new rhythmical perspective that can be applied to enhance every bar of music you play, in a any genre or your money back.

wp_post.post_content:
Explore A New Realm Of African Rhythm

On the most westerly tip of Africa lies the country of Senegal – responsible for giving the world such superstars as Youssou N’Dour, Baaba Maal, Orchestra Baobab, Toure Kunda, Super Diamono and many, many more – and deep within the downtown streets of its capital city Dakar, the rhythm Mbalax was born. Piercing sabar drums call out with odd measure phrases, synthetic marimba sounds blare over loudspeakers and people dance all night, competing for the best moves. 

The traditional music of Senegal rhythmically defies the rest of the African continent with a powerful pulse, often considered confusing and requiring international pop hits to be toned down in order to be universally understood, felt and danced to. A mini orchestra of tonal sabar percussion with the combination of varying sizes and pitch of drums – chol, mbung bung and tama (the lizard skin talking drum) – makes up the ancestral background of modern Senegalese drum kit rhythms. This in turn defines the unique bass style by the note placement and accents, which at first listen may seem disjointed, out of place, even a little strange.

Study it further to truly understand a new way to play.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Become a more exciting bass player and learn the full vocabulary of Senegalese music in just 30 days or your money back.

wp_post.post_content:
Gain Confidence In African Grooves

A common saying in western pop and rock music is that you don’t notice the bass guitar until it’s gone. In Africa, this statement couldn’t be further from the truth. The African bass is not a background player – it’s the driving force that dictates whether the crowd dances, takes a break, or heads home for the night. Congolese nightclubs are famous for 5-hour marathon concerts, and the bass player is who makes that happen.

The importance of the bassline to African music is easy to identify, but the techniques and skills used are much more difficult to conquer. The thought process behind the bassline is an art form in itself, and you’d have to spend the next 20 years traveling the continent town to town to ever stand a chance at fully grasping everything.

You need an experienced pro to show you the way.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Create exceptionally rhythmical basslines to direct any African dancefloor & improve rapidly in just 30 days or your money back with this complete guide to Soukous, Sungura and Zouk.

wp_post.post_content:
Unlock the Power of African Bass

In African music, the bass isn’t just a supporting instrument, it’s the engine that drives the groove. From the hypnotic pulse of Congolese Sebene to the intricate phrasing of West African griot music, the bass dictates whether a crowd dances, rests, or keeps moving until sunrise.

This course is designed to give you the technical skills and deep musical understanding needed to play authentic African basslines. Whether you’re locking into the relentless groove of Zimbabwean Sungura, navigating the rolling energy of Senegalese Mbalax, or building the foundation of Afrobeat, you’ll develop the control, endurance, and feel required to sound like a pro.

Forget generic exercises - this is a practical, immersive journey into the rhythms that have shaped modern music worldwide. With direct guidance from Edd Bateman, a bassist who has toured with Africa’s greatest musicians, you’ll learn to adapt, create, and groove like never before.

Warning: Potential Side Effects of Taking This Course

  • Your basslines might be so groovy that once the crowd starts moving, they won’t let you off the stage.
  • Drummers will start locking in with you so tightly, you'll feel like you share a brain.
  • You may develop an unstoppable urge to play for hours, completely losing track of time.

Key Learning Outcomes

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

Master Essential African Bass Techniques

  • Play with precision and endurance using authentic African right-hand techniques.
  • Strengthen left-hand dexterity for fast-moving and syncopated basslines.
  • Maintain stamina for extended performances, as seen in marathon African concerts.

Develop an Authentic African Groove

  • Lock into the pulse of Soukous, Sungura, Mbalax, Afrobeat, and more.
  • Create natural-sounding bass variations to drive the rhythm forward.
  • Understand the role of bass as a melodic and rhythmic force in African music.

Expand Your Musical Vocabulary

  • Adapt traditional African basslines into different genres, including pop and funk.
  • Incorporate call-and-response phrasing into your playing.
  • Play alongside percussionists and drummers with confidence and precision.

Apply Your Skills in a Live Setting

  • Navigate common African chord progressions and song structures.
  • Improvise basslines while maintaining groove and syncopation.
  • Develop a deep understanding of how African bass players shape the energy of a performance.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Create exceptionally rhythmical basslines to direct any African dancefloor & improve rapidly in just 30 days or your money back with this complete guide to Soukous, Sungura, Zouk, Afrobeat, Mbalax, Maskandi & more.

Sample Lessons

[aiovg_videos template="popup" tag="124" orderby="date" columns="3" limit="15"]

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor: Edd Bateman

At 14 years old, Edd Bateman was playing heavy metal basslines in his bedroom when his mother interrupted with an unexpected opportunity. A Zimbabwean Sungura and Chimurenga dance band, Chimanimani, had just arrived in England and needed a bass player immediately. With barely a week to prepare, Edd took the gig. Within a month, he found himself playing African nightclubs in London, university venues, and even Glastonbury Festival. He stayed with Chimanimani for six years, learning the intricacies of Zimbabwean bass firsthand.

In his early 20s, Edd’s focus shifted to West Africa, where he began intensive training with the Cissokho family of griots in Senegal. Performing marathon five-hour shows alongside Solo Cissokho, Seckou Keita, Sadio Cissokho, and the Jalikunda family, he absorbed the deep rhythmic traditions of Mbalax and Mandinka music. Guest appearances with Cheikh Lô, Orchestra Baobab, and Super Diamono solidified his reputation as a versatile and instinctive player.

With thousands of concerts to his name, Edd has led bands blending African and global styles, including London Astrobeat Orchestra and Edd Bateman’s West African Love Affair. In 2020, recognizing the lack of structured learning for African bass guitar, he founded World Music Method, an online platform dedicated to sharing the techniques and traditions of African and world music.

In 2024, Edd was called in at the last minute to tour with Sahara Desert Blues virtuoso Bombino, stepping onto the stage without rehearsal. In 2025, he expanded his musical journey to India and Pakistan, performing alongside Ustad Shafqat Ali Khan and leading members of the Sham Chaurasi Gharana. His deep foundation in African music allowed him to adapt instantly, navigating unfamiliar repertoire on the spot, a skill that defines a truly masterful bass player.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

 

African Bass Masterclass - Deluxe

5.5 hours of detailed lessons teaching you to be proficient in Soukous, Sungura, Zouk, Afrobeat, Maskandi and Mbalax bass styles.

 

Interactive On-Screen Notation

Learning new skills is easier with our innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, virtual fretboards, slow motion and more.

 

African Backing Tracks

Put your new techniques into practice and jam over traditional African grooves so you can develop your own authentic feel and be confident playing in a variety of new styles.

 

Sebene Heaven - Ebook

The bitter-sweet paradox of Congolese Rumba. Andy Morgan’s eBook details the gripping history of the countries main musical export.

 

Bakithi Kumalo - Masterclass

Learn from the best. Watch legendary South African bassist Bakithi Kumalo’s exclusive World Music Method masterclass and apply his principles into your own musical development.

wp_post.post_content:
Could Your Guitar Sound More Melodic?

Most guitarists think in terms of rhythm and lead, chords and melody - but true mastery comes from blending them into one seamless voice. The best players don’t just play the notes; they make the instrument sing.

In Peru, music is a conversation, between past and present, theinstruments, between the dancer and the rhythm. Huayño’s soaring melodies climb and tumble like the Andean landscape, Peruvian waltz flows with elegance before twisting into unexpected syncopation, and Festejo surges forward with the fiery pulse of Afro-Peruvian percussion. These styles aren’t just techniques to learn, they’re new ways to shape melody, control dynamics, and bring life to every note you play.

Led by award-winning guitarist Camilo Menjura, this course breaks down the essential techniques of Peruvian guitar, translating the energy of full ensembles into a solo guitar approach. You’ll develop a deeper understanding of phrasing, rhythmic flexibility, and harmonic movement while learning rich, expressive arrangements from one of the most musically diverse regions in the world.

If you’re ready to expand your musical vocabulary, unlock new levels of expression, and transform the way you approach the guitar, this course is for you.

Key Learning Outcomes

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

Master Essential Peruvian Guitar Styles

  • Develop an authentic feel for Huayño, Carnavalito, Waltz, Festejo, and Landó.
  • Learn strumming and fingerstyle techniques specific to each genre.

Enhance Your Technical & Musical Skills

  • Build precision in syncopated rhythms and dynamic phrasing.
  • Combine chord-melody playing with intricate bass movements.
  • Learn to adapt multi-instrument arrangements to a solo guitar.

Deepen Your Understanding of Peruvian Music

  • Explore the historical and cultural significance behind each style.
  • Understand the guitar’s role in Andean, Creole, and Afro-Peruvian traditions.

Play With Authenticity and Confidence

  • Learn directly from Camilo Menjura, a specialist in Latin American folk guitar.
  • Develop a versatile repertoire suited for both solo and ensemble performance.
wp_post.post_excerpt: From Huayño to the Peruvian Waltz, immerse yourself in Andean culture and develop new guitar talents in just 30 days or your money back.

sample-lessons.tab_content:
Sample Lessons

[aiovg_videos template="popup" tag="122"]

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor: Camilo Menjura

Born in Bogotá, Camilo Menjura is a guitarist, arranger, and composer recognized for his deep mastery of Latin American folk music. His journey began by learning Colombian folk styles by ear before formally studying classical guitar at one of Colombia’s top music academies.

Camilo’s expertise extends across multiple traditions, from Andean, Cuban, and Brazilian folk to intricate classical and jazz arrangements. His rare ability to translate complex multi-instrumental textures into rich solo guitar performances has made him a sought-after performer and educator.

Twice awarded UK Latin Musician of the Year, Camilo has performed at WOMAD, The Mali Festival of the Desert, and international music festivals worldwide. As the leader of London’s World Music Choir, his work celebrates the global power of music.

In this course, Camilo shares not just technique, but the deep cultural essence and emotion that define Peruvian guitar.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

Peruvian Guitar Styles

60 minutes of detailed lessons teaching you to be proficient in some of Peru's popular and folkloric genres including Wayñu, Carnavalito and Waltz.

 

Interactive On-screen Notation

Learning new skills is easier with our innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, slow motion and more.

 

Landó Masterclass

Take your study further with a 1 hour masterclass in the guitar styles played within the popular Afro-Peruvian style Landó.

 

Festejo Masterclass

Camilo Menjura's Festejo masterclass will take you deeper into understanding this coastal genre known for accompanying one of Peru's famed dance styles.

wp_post.post_content:
your musical journey

Explore The Sounds Of The Mediterranean

The Mediterranean has long been a centre of musical innovation, where styles and instruments travel freely across cultures and borders. In Mediterranean Guitar Styles, world-renowned guitarist Fernando Perez brings this vibrant musical heritage to life, teaching you to master the intricate rhythms, ornamentation, and expressive techniques of Bulgarian Rachenitza, Egyptian Oud-inspired guitar, Spanish Rumba Flamenca, and Greek Rebetiko.

This course offers more than just technical skill, it’s a deep dive into the cultural and historical contexts that shaped these iconic styles. From mastering odd-metered Bulgarian dance rhythms to replicating the evocative sound of the oud on guitar, and from the driving energy of Spanish Rumba to the soulful melodies of Rebetiko, you’ll develop techniques that will enhance your playing in any genre.

Fernando’s clear guidance and rich expertise make this an inspiring journey for guitarists of all levels who are eager to expand their musical horizons and discover the beauty of Mediterranean music.

Key Learning Outcomes

By the end of Mediterranean Guitar Styles, you will:

Master Mediterranean Styles

  • Play Bulgarian Rachenitza, Egyptian Oud-inspired compositions, Spanish Rumba, and Greek Rebetiko with authenticity and confidence.
  • Understand the unique rhythms, scales, and ornamentation that define these traditions.

Enhance Technical Proficiency

  • Develop right-hand control for complex rhythms like 7/8 and 9/8 meters.
  • Strengthen left-hand dexterity through ornamentation techniques, including slides, trills, and tremolos.
  • Replicate the phrasing and tone of traditional Mediterranean instruments like the oud and bouzouki.

Understand Cultural Contexts

  • Gain insight into the cultural and historical roots of Mediterranean music.
  • Learn how musical traditions from the region reflect the social and communal life of their origins.

Expand Creative Expression

  • Adapt Mediterranean techniques into your own playing style, enriching your musical vocabulary.
  • Build a deeper connection to global music traditions and enhance your artistic storytelling.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Combine Greek Rebetiko, Bulgarian Rachenitza, Egyptian Oud-inspired techniques and Spanish Rumba guitar styles to reinvent what you thought was possible on your instrument.

_learndash_course_grid_short_description:
Music brings people together, and nowhere is that more evident than in the Mediterranean. For generations, musical styles, techniques, and instruments have traveled freely across the sea.

When we talk about Mediterranean guitar music, dozens of images and sounds come to mind. Are you standing in a crowded market in Egypt as a street performer captivates listeners gathered around him? Maybe you are in a Spanish flamenco bar, watching as dancers move to the up-tempo sounds of the rumba flamenca? Or at a community gathering celebrating the occasion with the Bulgarian Rachentiza or the Greek Rebetiko?

These unique styles have some key differences, but they also share many distinct similarities – that’s the beauty of the Mediterranean guitar.

_sfwd-courses.sfwd-courses_course_short_description:

When we talk about Mediterranean guitar music, dozens of images and sounds come to mind. Are you standing in a crowded market in Egypt as a street performer captivates listeners gathered around him? Maybe you are in a Spanish flamenco bar, watching as dancers move to the up-tempo sounds of the rumba flamenca? Or at a community gathering celebrating the occasion with the Bulgarian Rachentiza or the Greek Rebetiko?

These unique styles have some key differences, but they also share many distinct similarities – that’s the beauty of the Mediterranean guitar.

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor: Fernando Perez

 

Fernando Perez is a master musician who began playing Spanish guitar aged seven and by the following year was enrolled in the Zaragoza music conservatory. He has since dedicated 40 years to immersing himself in the detailed study of each of the worlds’ major, and lesser known guitar styles. From B.B Kings’ Hollywood blues club to Egypt’s Alexandria Opera House, Fernando has performed the world over for music lovers, guitar enthusiasts and royalty alike (ranging from Kings and Queens to Prince – the artist formerly known as.)

Having contributed to multiple Grammy award winning productions, released over 20 of his own world guitar dedicated albums and featured on educational publications by Hal Leonard, Stefan Grossman Guitar Workshop, Mel Bay, Universal and Warner, Fernando takes his inspiration from an ever unquenched thirst for musical knowledge.

He’s studied and/or taught traditional music at Maui Music Conservatory (Hawaii), Istanbul University (Turkey), Shanghai Music conservatory (China), Labyrinth Music Centre (Greece) and Musicians Institute (USA) on a never ending journey of personal guitar development. He took his guitar and lived in Egypt, Greece and India embarking in the search for local masters who would teach him the secrets of their native music.”

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

 

Mediterranean Guitar Styles

Allow Fernando Perez to be your guide in this 1 hour 40 minute course teaching you the exotic nuances of some of the Mediterranean Sea's best preserved musical traditions from Egypt, Greece, Spain and Bulgaria.

 


Interactive On-Screen Notation

Learning new skills is easier with our innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, animated fretboard diagrams, variable tempos, and more today.

 

Masterclass And Q&A

Receive your invitation to the next live masterclass and Q&A and gain immediate feedback and answers from Fernando.

rank_math_description: Learn Spanish rumba guitar, Egyptian music, Bulgarian Rachenitza and Greek Rebetiko blues in online guitar lessons with Fernando. Perez.

wp_post.post_content:
Go Back to the Source. Play with Soul.

Can you remember the first riff you ever learned on guitar? Where did it come from? Follow the sound back through Hendrix, through the blues, past rock ‘n’ roll and you’ll arrive in Mali, West Africa, where the DNA of modern guitar music was formed long before it had a name.

This is where rhythm and melody move together as one. Where a single guitar line can drive an entire song. In this course, Vieux Farka Touré takes you inside the traditions that shaped Ali Farka Touré, the Delta blues, and the music that followed. You’ll learn how to build infectious guitar lines, phrase with fluidity, and lock into the deep, looping cycles of Malian rhythm.

This isn’t about scales or licks - it’s about understanding how the music works. If you want to break free from rigid patterns, hear rhythm differently, and tap into the true roots of guitar, this course will take you there.

Key Learning Outcomes

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

Master the Foundations of Malian Blues

  • Learn essential rhythms and phrasing from North and Central Mali.
  • Develop right-hand techniques that create hypnotic, groove-driven guitar lines.
  • Understand the pentatonic language of Malian guitar and how it shapes improvisation.

Explore the Sounds of Mali’s Major Traditions

  • Study Mandingue kora-inspired guitar licks and the style of Djelimady Tounkara.
  • Learn Fula (Peul) melodies and tunings, rich in microtonal expression.
  • Play the Tuareg Desert Blues style, driven by percussive picking and modal phrasing.

Develop a Deep Groove & Improvisational Feel

  • Lock into Takamba, Diama Diama, and Bwa rhythms using the calabash drum.
  • Learn traditional Malian ornamentation like triolets and octave techniques.
  • Develop fluid, expressive solos that mimic the phrasing of griot singers and kora players.

Bring Authentic Malian Techniques Into Your Own Playing

  • Adapt Malian Blues phrasing to electric and acoustic guitar.
  • Learn when to leave space, when to repeat, and how to build tension naturally.
  • Understand the storytelling approach of Malian improvisation—letting your guitar speak.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Go beyond scales and licks, unlock the heart of Malian groove.

_learndash_course_grid_short_description: In this course you’ll learn about the musical approaches of major Malian ethnic groups like the Mandingue, Fula and Tuareg, how to groove along with classic rhythms from North and Central Mali, the original Desert Blues style of Ali Farka Toure and how to make your guitar solos sing.

_sfwd-courses.sfwd-courses_course_short_description: In this course you’ll learn about the musical approaches of major Malian ethnic groups like the Mandingue, Fula and Tuareg, how to groove along with classic rhythms from North and Central Mali, the original Desert Blues style of Ali Farka Toure and how to make your guitar solos sing.

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor: Vieux Farka Touré

Vieux Farka Touré—often called "The Hendrix of the Sahara"—was born in Niafunké, Northern Mali. The son of legendary guitarist Ali Farka Touré, Vieux was initially expected to become a soldier. But his passion for music was undeniable. He secretly began learning guitar in 2001, and by 2007, he had released his debut album featuring his father and kora virtuoso Toumani Diabaté.

His career took off fast. In 2010, Vieux performed at the FIFA World Cup opening ceremony in South Africa, and his next album featured collaborations with John Scofield, Dave Matthews, and Derek Trucks. A passionate advocate for Malian music and culture, he founded Amahrec Sahel, a charity supporting orphans and young musicians.

Now signed to World Circuit Records/BMG, his 2022 album "Les Racines" (Roots) marks a return to the deep Desert Blues sound his father introduced to the world. With this course, Vieux shares his mastery of Malian guitar, offering students a rare opportunity to learn from one of the most authentic voices in modern African music.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

 

Malian Guitar Evolution

Study Malian guitar styles from throughout the country and the ages with West Africa’s legendary virtuoso guitarist ‘Vieux Farka Toure’.

 

Interactive On-screen Notation

Learning new skills is easier with our innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, virtual fretboards, slow motion and more.

 

Masterclass

Join the next live session or watch the recording and get your questions answered directly by Vieux.

 

 

Calabash Backing Tracks

Put your new techniques into practice and Jam over different Malian grooves with Calabash player Adama Kone.

wp_post.post_content:
enhance your repertoire with

Generations of South American Sounds

Shift from the chilled sound of Son to the chill of the Andean mountains where Bambuco is a favourite folk genre. It’s fluid and percussive by turns: a lyrical, hypnotic, reflective, but fiery and passionate Spanish/indigenous mix. An alluring, flirtatious accompaniment to the dance of the same name, it has romance at its core. Discover how to feel it as you learn how to play it. Time to master the art of South America’s most sensual guitar style!

Expand Your Musical Horizons Today
wp_post.post_excerpt: Heighten your knowledge of Colombian and Cuban guitar and advance rapidly in just 30 days or your money back.

wp_post.post_content:
Become Fluent In Latin American Folk Guitar

Welcome to the intensely syncopated Cuban style of “Son” folk music, made famous by the Buena Vista Social Club. Multiple musical roots combine to create Son’s lively but laid-back, up-beat and spirited sound. Re-invented for solo guitar by the masterly Camilo Menjura, this course puts a whole 13-piece band in your own two hands.

In creating this course, Camilo broke down the multiple parts of Son and the Colombo-Venezuelan border sounds of Joropo and then re-constructed them to fit six strings. He leads you through a radically original combination of left and right-hand techniques which together recreate the syncopated sound of traditional folk instruments and percussion that characterise Latin America. He demystifies the music by demonstrating the simplest of steps in graded tempos.

If you fancy a trip into the intricate, mesmerizing music of South America, guided by one of the greats, then pack your bags and travel with the maestro.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Elevate your guitar vocabulary with Colombian and Cuban styles and improve significantly in just 30 days or your money back.

wp_post.post_content:
Don’t Just Play The Guitar, Feel It

Latin American folk music isn’t just something you play - it’s something you live, breathe, and feel. From the driving pulse of Cuban Son to the galloping swing of Venezuela’s Joropo and the soaring mountain melodies of Andean Bambuco, these aren’t just rhythms—they’re conversations between melody, harmony, and groove.

Led by award-winning Colombian guitarist Camilo Menjura, this course takes you beyond technique and into the soul of Latin American guitar traditions. You’ll learn how to replicate the percussive depth of entire ensembles, weaving together basslines, harmony, and rhythm with just your guitar. Whether you’re looking to bring more groove and fluidity into your playing or master the art of creating a full, rich sound as a solo guitarist, this course gives you the tools to do it.

By breaking down the techniques of Cuban Son, Joropo, and Bambuco, you’ll develop a natural, instinctive connection to groove, one that goes beyond counting beats and becomes something you internalize, move with, and truly feel.

This isn’t just about learning new songs. It’s about transforming the way you hear and play music. By the end of this course, Latin rhythms won’t be something you think about, they’ll be something that flows effortlessly through your hands.

If you’re ready to break out of rigid patterns, elevate your solo guitar playing, and bring Latin American fire into your sound, this course will take you there.

Key Learning Outcomes

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

Develop a Deep Sense of Latin American Rhythm

  • Learn the syncopated strumming techniques of Cuban Son, Joropo, and Bambuco.
  • Master right-hand independence and complex rhythmic phrasing.
  • Internalize clave, triplet grooves, and cross-rhythms for natural, flowing accompaniment.

Expand Your Harmonic and Melodic Knowledge

  • Explore chord substitutions and reharmonization techniques used in Latin music.
  • Study major Latin progressions and their role in melody and improvisation.
  • Develop left-hand control for dynamic chord voicings and embellishments.

Replicate Full Latin Ensembles on Solo Guitar

  • Reconstruct the multiple instrumental layers of a Latin band into a single guitar part.
  • Apply melodic basslines, percussive strumming, and syncopated accents.
  • Adapt traditional folk phrasing to solo guitar performance.

Understand the Cultural and Historical Context

  • Learn how African, Indigenous, and European influences shaped Latin American styles.
  • Explore the musical evolution of Joropo, Cuban Son, and Bambuco.
  • Gain insight into the regional diversity of Latin American folk traditions.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Enlighten your guitar repertoire with a fresh perspective from Cuban, Colombian, and Venezuelan traditions

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor: Camilo Menjura

Camilo Menjura grew up in Bogotá, immersed in Colombia’s diverse folk traditions. He spent over a decade learning by ear before studying classical guitar at one of Colombia’s top music academies, refining his understanding of harmony, theory, and technique. His deep connection to both folk traditions and formal training makes him a unique bridge between traditional and contemporary approaches to Latin guitar.

Now based in the UK, Camilo has twice been named Musician of the Year at the UK Latin Awards. His career has taken him from composing film and theatre scores to performing at major festivals, including the Mali Festival of the Desert and WOMAD. He is also the founder and director of London’s World Music Choir, bringing together vocalists from across the globe.

Camilo’s teaching approach deconstructs complex Latin rhythms and techniques, making them accessible, playable, and deeply musical. Whether you're new to Latin American music or looking to refine your understanding of rhythm and groove, this course will give you the tools to play with confidence and authenticity.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

 

Latin American Folk Guitar – Deluxe

3 hours of detailed lessons teaching you how to be proficient in Joropo, Son and Bambuco whilst developing an authentic Latin American guitar feel.

 

Interactive On-screen Notation

Learning new skills is easier with our innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, virtual fretboards, slow motion and more.

 

Cuban Guitar Masterclass

Take your Cuban guitar study even further with 2 hours of bonus masterclasses learning some of Camilo’s favourite guitar pieces.

 

Cumbia Guitar Masterclass

Learn another popular Colombian guitar style in Camilo’s 1 hour masterclass with a detailed guide to the rhythms of Cumbia.

 

Latin American Backing Tracks

Put your new techniques into practice and jam over traditional Joropo and Son grooves so you can develop your own authentic feel and be confident playing in a variety of new styles.

rank_math_description: Learn Colombian/Venezuelan Joropo and Cuban Son guitar styles in South American music lessons by Camilo Menjura with guitar tab and PDF.

wp_post.post_content:
Unlock The Polyrhythmic Soul Of Your Guitar

If you're feeling stuck in your guitar playing, the kora offers a completely new way of thinking about melody, rhythm, and groove. For over 700 years, kora players have mastered the art of weaving basslines, melodies, and rhythmic patterns together, creating some of the most hypnotic and polyrhythmic music in the world. Now, you can bring that same approach to your guitar.

This course, led by Derek Gripper, teaches you how to capture the rolling basslines, cascading melodies, and deep rhythmic feel of the kora all on a six-string guitar. You'll learn to adapt the intricate compositions of Toumani Diabaté, develop right-hand independence, and discover how West African phrasing and polyrhythms can transform the way you play.

This isn't just about learning a few kora pieces. It's about breaking free from conventional guitar habits, expanding your ear, and internalizing a whole new way of playing. Whether you're a classical guitarist, a fingerstyle player, or simply looking to expand your musical vocabulary, this course will open up a world of new possibilities.

Your guitar will never feel the same again.

Key Learning Outcomes

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

Capture the Essence of Kora on Guitar

  • Learn kora-inspired right-hand plucking patterns and phrasing.
  • Develop a rolling bass technique while maintaining melodic independence.
  • Master the polyrhythmic interplay that defines kora music.

Study the Legacy of Toumani Diabaté

  • Learn Lam Tooro, Konkoba, and Jaarabi, essential pieces in the kora repertoire.
  • Understand how Derek Gripper adapted kora music to guitar.
  • Explore improvisation techniques within West African traditions.

Develop Your Own West African-Inspired Sound

  • Apply kora-inspired techniques to fingerstyle guitar and composition.
  • Strengthen right-hand dexterity and rhythmic control.
  • Explore the historical and cultural depth behind the music.
wp_post.post_excerpt: 700 years of griot history, channeled through your guitar.

sample-lessons.tab_content:
Sample Lessons

[aiovg_videos template="popup" tag="119" orderby="date" show_player_title="1"]

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor: Derek Gripper

Derek Gripper is a guitarist who has redefined the possibilities of the six-string guitar. Through years of dedicated transcription and performance, he has brought the complex, flowing compositions of Malian kora virtuoso Toumani Diabaté into the guitar world. His album One Night on Earth stunned listeners with its ability to translate the delicate polyphony of the kora onto a Western instrument, earning praise from both John Williams and Diabaté himself.

His journey has taken him to the world’s most prestigious venues, from Carnegie Hall to global festival stages, blending the traditions of African music with classical guitar technique. His innovative Kora Guitar Lessons have inspired musicians worldwide, offering both technical mastery and a deep appreciation for the storytelling traditions of West African griots.

In this course, Derek shares his approach to kora-inspired guitar playing, helping you unlock new textures, phrasing, and polyrhythms that will transform your understanding of the instrument.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

Kora Mastery On Guitar

Transform your guitar into a kora with 160 minutes of carefully constructed kora guitar lessons from the pioneer of this field.

 

Interactive On-screen Notation

Learning new skills is easier with our innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, virtual fretboards, slow motion and more.

 

Derek Gripper – Masterclass

Take your studies further with two hours of bonus material learning how to play in the style of Ali Farka Toure.

 

Compás Backing Grooves

Put your new techniques into practice and Jam over different Malian grooves with Calabash player Adama Kone.

wp_post.post_content:
The Hindustani music of northern India is one of the world’s great art forms: astonishingly rich and intellectually complex (but at the same time emotionally powerful and direct), these musical traditions are stunning to listen to and enriching to play. Developed over more than a thousand years, this ancient-yet-living music has absorbed folk traditions, religious ritual and the instruments of foreign invaders.

The Hindustani slide guitar is an example of this remarkable musical blend – while the guitar is a Western instrument its origins are in the string traditions of India and Central Asia. Thus when Indian musicians embraced the guitar they didn’t simply copy Westerners, instead they adapted it to the ragas played on sitar and sarod. What they developed is one of the world’s most unique and hauntingly beautiful slide guitar styles.

Here East meets West and musical enlightenment beckons.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Engage your ears with ancient Indian ragas and develop a brand new guitar repertoire in just 30 days or your money back.

wp_post.post_content:
The Hindustani music of northern India is one of the world’s great art forms: astonishingly rich and intellectually complex (but at the same time emotionally powerful and direct), these musical traditions are stunning to listen to and enriching to play. Developed over more than a thousand years, this ancient-yet-living music has absorbed folk traditions, religious ritual and the instruments of foreign invaders.

The Hindustani slide guitar is an example of this remarkable musical blend – while the guitar is a Western instrument its origins are in the string traditions of India and Central Asia. Thus when Indian musicians embraced the guitar they didn’t simply copy Westerners, instead they adapted it to the ragas played on sitar and sarod. What they developed is one of the world’s most unique and hauntingly beautiful slide guitar styles.

Here East meets West and musical enlightenment beckons.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Engage your ears with ancient Indian ragas and develop a brand new guitar repertoire in just 30 days or your money back.

wp_post.post_content:
Interpret Ragas Authentically On Any Six-String Guitar

Hindustani classical music is one of the world’s most profound and expressive traditions. Rooted in centuries of improvisation, intricate melodic phrasing, and rhythmic precision, it carries deep spiritual and emotional weight. The Hindustani slide guitar is a unique bridge between East and West, blending Indian raga phrasing with the fluid, singing quality of the slide.

In this course, Fernando Perez plays an Indian slide guitar, a six-string instrument with additional sympathetic strings that resonate like those on a sitar. However, this course is designed for any guitarist with a six-string instrument. Whether you play steel-string acoustic, electric slide guitar, Dobro, or even if you're new to slide playing, these techniques can be adapted to your instrument. The focus is not just on the gear, but on understanding Indian ragas, phrasing, and ornamentation, expanding your harmonic knowledge, and transforming the way you think about melody and expression.

Rather than simply replicating melodies, you’ll gain the skills to interpret ragas with authenticity and feeling, using the slide guitar as a tool for deep musical expression. Whether you're a guitarist seeking to expand your musical horizons or a student of Indian classical music looking to explore a new instrument, this course will give you the knowledge and technique to play with confidence.

Key Learning Outcomes

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

Build a Strong Foundation in Hindustani Slide Guitar

  • Understand the structure of Indian classical music and the concept of raga.
  • Learn the fundamentals of tuning, phrasing, and ornamentation on slide guitar.
  • Develop rhythmic precision by studying Taal cycles and tabla accompaniment.

Master the Techniques of Indian Slide Guitar

  • Learn meend (gliding between notes) for smooth melodic phrasing.
  • Apply gamakas and ornamentation to bring life to your melodies.
  • Develop a strong right-hand technique for speed, control, and dynamics.

Play and Interpret Traditional Ragas

  • Study Raga Bhupali, Raga Bhairavi, Raga Khamaj, and Raga Chandrakauns.
  • Perform traditional Dhun, Bandish, and Tihai variations on slide guitar.
  • Understand how to improvise within the structure of a raga.

Explore the Cultural and Historical Context

  • Learn the origins of Hindustani slide guitar and its evolution from sitar and sarod traditions.
  • Understand the connection between raga and mood, time of day, and emotion.
  • Discover how Indian classical music has influenced global genres and contemporary guitar playing.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Indian ragas will revolutionize your note choice on guitar forever.

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor: Fernando Perez

Fernando Perez is a globally recognized guitarist and multi-instrumentalist who has spent over 40 years exploring the world’s musical traditions. He began playing Spanish guitar at the age of seven, later enrolling in the Zaragoza Music Conservatory. His lifelong dedication to musical study has taken him across continents, learning and performing in diverse cultural settings.

His career has led him from B.B. King’s Hollywood blues club to the Alexandria Opera House in Egypt, performing for audiences ranging from dedicated guitar enthusiasts to royalty. He has contributed to multiple Grammy-winning productions, released over 20 albums dedicated to world guitar styles, and authored educational materials for Hal Leonard, Universal, and Warner.

Fernando’s study of Indian music began after hearing the work of V.M. Bhatt and Debashish Bhattacharya. Inspired by their mastery, he relocated to Jaipur, spending three years immersed in Hindustani classical training. His experience at institutions such as the Shanghai Music Conservatory, Istanbul University, and Labyrinth Music Centre has further deepened his knowledge of global string traditions.

For Fernando, Indian classical music is not about technical virtuosity alone but about conveying the essence of a raga so vividly that it manifests in the space around you. In this course, he shares the deep knowledge and refined technique that allow him to bring this ancient art to life on the slide guitar.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

Hindustani Slide Guitar – Deluxe

4 hours 20 minutes of detailed lessons teaching you to be proficient in Hindustani music with a strong understanding of rhythm, melody, ragas and slide guitar techniques.

 

Interactive On-screen Notation

Learning new skills is easier with our innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, virtual fretboards, slow motion and more.

 

Fernando Perez – Masterclass

Engage in some additional study watching Fernando explain Indian music further during this 90 minute masterclass.

 

Indian Backing Tracks

Put your new techniques into practice and jam over traditional Indian grooves so you can develop your own authentic feel and be confident playing in a variety of new styles.

rank_math_description: Learn how to play Indian ragas and Hindustani slide guitar techniques on a standard 6-string guitar in online lessons with Fernando Perez.

wp_post.post_content:
enrich your repertoire

Desert Blues - The Sound Of The Sahara

Imagine traveling from the Middle East into Africa. What sound would you be hearing as you encountered nomadic caravans camped at each desert oasis? Likely it would be desert blues, a music both ancient and contemporary, a guitar style that is beautifully haunted yet capable of wild, spontaneous improvisation and intense rhythmic groove.

In these remote lands, often torn apart by conflict, music brings people together: the Festival in the Desert in Northern Mali existed as the most exciting celebration of guitar-based music anywhere. Here musicians from across the world gathered to hear and learn desert blues guitar. This elemental sound blends the Tuareg musicians of the Sahel region with the mystical healing tones of the Moroccan gnawa and the African timbre found in the ancient and beautiful music of Mali, Senegal and Mauritania. Shaped by ancient civilizations, the very basis of blues and jazz, rock and trance, a sound that inspires souls to fly.

One thousand years of North African history…..plugged into an amplifier.

Key Learning Outcomes

Upon successful completion of this course, participants will be able to:

Master North African Rhythms

  • Play fundamental North African and desert guitar grooves, including Darabuka and 6/8 rhythms.
  • Develop a strong sense of timing and phrasing within traditional rhythmic structures.

Perform Desert Blues and Sufi Music

  • Learn and interpret classic desert songs such as Sidi Mansour, Ighzayel Mayel, and Zahir Teneray.
  • Adapt these melodies with authentic phrasing and rhythmic variations.

Apply Unique Guitar Tunings and Techniques

  • Explore traditional desert guitar tunings, including those used by Tinariwen and other Tuareg musicians.
  • Utilize desert-inspired techniques to create fluid, hypnotic guitar lines.

Understand Moroccan and Gnawa Musical Traditions

  • Study the cultural and musical significance of Gnawa music and its connection to trance-like rhythms.
  • Incorporate Moroccan and Gnawa influences into your own playing.

Integrate North African Styles into Contemporary Music

  • Fuse desert blues techniques with modern guitar styles for a richer musical vocabulary.
  • Expand your improvisational approach by incorporating Saharan phrasing and microtonal ornamentation.

Enhance Your Practice with Additional Learning Tools

  • Utilize backing tracks, ebooks, and masterclass recordings to refine your understanding of North African guitar traditions.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Unlock a world of North African Groove and rapidly advance your guitar playing in just 30 days or your money back.

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor: Justin Adams

Justin Adams needs little introduction, he being one of Britain’s master guitarists - whether he’s Robert Plant’s right-hand man or Jah Wobble’s foil, producer of Tinariwen and Rachid Taha, a studio collaborator with the likes of Brian Eno and Sinead O’Connor, half of the JUJU duo with Gambian griot Juldeh Camara or joining Ben Mandelson and Lu Edmonds in maverick folk trio Les Triaboliques.

Adams' long connection with the music emanating from the Sahara and North Africa has ensured that he is amongst the most influential electric guitarists of the 21st Century. Just as his British forefathers Jeff Beck and Eric Clapton picked up on US blues and rockabilly to pioneer new levels of dynamic improvisation in rock guitar, Adams’ immersion in (and understanding of) the music of the Berbers and Tuareg - who roam the Sahara - and the griots of Africa has literally expanded and enriched the electric guitar’s sonic palette.

Born in London and spending his early childhood years in Egypt - his father was a diplomat - Adams grew up loving both the British pop/rock music he heard on the BBC and the North African music encountered on the streets and souks of Cairo. As a young guitarist back in Britain it was his ability to blend elements of both musical cultures that made him such a distinctive musician and an in-demand player for visionary producers and band leaders who wanted to step outside convention.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

 

Desert Guitar - Origins

Absorb the rhythms of North Africa and the Sahara then learn about the guitar approaches from Moroccan, Algerian, Tunisian, Malian and Egyptian genres in this 1 hour 40 minute course.

 

Interactive On-screen Notation

Our state of the art learning technology speeds up studying with innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, animated fretboards, variable tempos, and more today.

 

Masterclass

Receive your invitation to the next live masterclass and Q&A and gain immediate feedback and answers from Justin Adams.

 

North African Backing Tracks

Put your new techniques into practice and jam with Justin over traditional North African guitar grooves so you can develop your own authentic feel and be confident playing in a variety of new styles.

 

Sounds Of The Sahara – Ebook

Through a collection of articles by Andy Morgan learn about the different artists pioneering Saharan guitar music.

wp_post.post_content:
Learn Colombian Gaita

Experience the soul of Colombia’s Caribbean coast and immerse yourself in the vibrant sounds of Gaita music with La Perla, globally celebrated ambassadors of this captivating tradition.

Picture the scene: a lively village along Colombia’s Caribbean coast, where the hypnotic melodies of flutes, the pulsating rhythms of hand drums, and the shimmering textures of maracas fill the air. Gaita music, rooted in the fusion of Indigenous, African, and Spanish traditions, is more than just a genre - it’s a cultural legacy that celebrates history, resilience, and community.

In this course, La Perla - renowned for their deep immersion in rural communities and years of study with master musicians - guide you through a comprehensive exploration of this art form. You’ll master the Gaita Hembra and Gaita Macho, the dynamic flutes that form the melodic core of Gaita ensembles, as well as the rhythmic complexities of the Tambor Alegre and Maracas.

Through structured lessons and ensemble demonstrations, you’ll gain both technical proficiency and a profound understanding of the historical and cultural context that gives Gaita music its enduring significance. From iconic songs like El Fin del Mundo to rhythmic styles such as the 6/8 Fandango, this course offers an academically enriching and transformative musical journey.

Whether you’re a musician ready to expand your horizons or a lover of global music traditions, this course provides a unique opportunity to connect with one of the world’s most spirited and culturally rich musical styles.

Key Learning Outcomes

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

Master Traditional Instruments

  • Play the Gaita Hembra and Gaita Macho, mastering scales, finger techniques, and ensemble interplay.
  • Develop dexterity, stamina, and rhythm with the Tambor Alegre.
  • Create complex rhythmic textures with both single and double Maracas.

Perform Traditional Gaita Repertoire

  • Learn and perform iconic Gaita tracks like El Fin del Mundo.
  • Understand song structures and improvisational techniques unique to Gaita music.

Deepen Your Rhythmic Knowledge

  • Play key rhythms such as the 6/8 Fandango and the Afro-Colombian Merengue, exploring their cultural and historical significance.
  • Strengthen your rhythmic feel and ensemble timing with interactive exercises.

Understand the Cultural Context

  • Gain insights into the history and significance of Gaita music, including its Indigenous, African, and Spanish roots.
  • Learn about legendary Gaiteros such as Jesús María Sayas and Toño García, whose contributions shaped the tradition.

Play Confidently in an Ensemble

  • Learn how the flutes, drums, and maracas interact to form a cohesive Gaita ensemble.
  • Apply techniques in solo and group settings, capturing the essence of Gaita performance.
wp_post.post_excerpt: The definitive guide to Colombian Gaita music. Master the Gaita Hembra, Gaita Macho, Tambor Alegre, and Maracas while gaining a deep understanding of this powerful and historic genre.

sample-lessons.tab_content:
Sample Lessons

[aiovg_videos template="popup" tag="219"]

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutors: La Perla

After years spent studying with master musicians in rural communities, each member of La Perla brings unique expertise to the group. Karen Nerak is a virtuoso of the Gaita Hembra, with a remarkable ability to weave soulful melodies that evoke the spirit of Colombia’s Afro-Indigenous heritage. Diana Sanmiguel complements this with her mastery of the Gaita Macho and Maracas, adding harmonic depth and rhythmic texture to the ensemble. Roberta Leono, an expert on the Tambor Alegre, provides the heartbeat of their performances, with driving rhythms that pulse with energy and precision. Together, they form a cohesive ensemble that brings both authenticity and innovation to their music.

La Perla are not just a band - they are cultural ambassadors who tour extensively across the globe, introducing audiences to the vibrant traditions of Gaita music. Their performances are electrifying, but they also strive to educate and inspire through workshops, masterclasses, and this course. Their deep respect for the roots of Gaita music, combined with their passion for sharing it with the world, makes La Perla the ideal guides for this immersive journey into one of Colombia’s most iconic musical traditions.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

Colombian Gaita Mastery

Master the vibrant art of Colombian Gaita with our online course, expertly guided by the renowned trio La Perla. Dive deep into comprehensive tutorials covering the gaita macho, gaita hembra, maracas, and tambora, while gaining a thorough understanding of ensemble structures and their cultural significance.

 

Interactive On-screen Notation

Learning new skills is easier with our innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, virtual fretboards, slow motion and more.

 

Masterclass

Delve into the history of La Perla and their inspiring journey as they explore and celebrate Afro-Colombian and indigenous music traditions.

 

Colombian Rhythms

Explore the rich tapestry of Colombian traditional rhythms such as Champeta, Bullerengue, and Cumbia through dynamic call-and-response drumming exercises.

wp_post.post_content:
Master The Congolese Guitar

This course profiles all of the greatest and most influential Congolese guitarists that shaped the genre of Sebene and teaches you their guitar lines with a step-by-step and clear instruction.

Learn and understand the iconic approaches from Franco Luambo Makiadi, Roxy Thsimpaka, Popolipo Beniko, Alain Makaba, Pépé Felly Manuaku and more.

You won’t just learn how to replicate a Congolese guitar line verbatim but will understand how to develop an authentic African feel whilst creating your own guitar lines which could confidently be performed with an ensemble.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Reinvent your repertoire learning awesome Congolese guitar licks to performance standard in just 30 days or your money back.

_learndash_course_grid_short_description:
This course profiles all of the greatest and most influential Congolese guitarists that shaped the genre of Sebene and teaches you their guitar lines with a step-by-step and clear instruction.

Learn and understand the iconic approaches from Franco Luambo Makiadi, Roxy Thsimpaka, Popolipo Beniko, Alain Makaba, Pépé Felly Manuaku and more.

You won’t just learn how to replicate a Congolese guitar line verbatim but will understand how to develop an authentic African feel whilst creating your own guitar lines which could confidently be performed with an ensemble.

_sfwd-courses.sfwd-courses_course_short_description:
This course profiles all of the greatest and most influential Congolese guitarists that shaped the genre of Sebene and teaches you their guitar lines with a step-by-step and clear instruction.

Learn and understand the iconic approaches from Franco Luambo Makiadi, Roxy Thsimpaka, Popolipo Beniko, Alain Makaba, Pépé Felly Manuaku and more.

You won’t just learn how to replicate a Congolese guitar line verbatim but will understand how to develop an authentic African feel whilst creating your own guitar lines which could confidently be performed with an ensemble.

wp_post.post_content:
Master The Congolese Guitar

This course profiles all of the greatest and most influential Congolese guitarists that shaped the genre of Sebene and teaches you their guitar lines with a step-by-step and clear instruction.

You'll study and learn the signature approaches of Franco Luambo Makiadi, Roxy Tshimpaka, Popolipo Beniko, Alain Makaba, Pépé Felly Manuaku, and more. Each lesson not only teaches their iconic guitar lines but also helps you develop an authentic African feel, refining your phrasing, groove, and articulation.

More than just replicating these lines, this course equips you to create your own Sebene-inspired guitar parts—allowing you to confidently perform in an ensemble with the dynamic energy and rhythmic precision that defines Congolese music.

Key Learning Outcomes

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

Build a Strong Foundation in Congolese Guitar

  • Develop fluency in call-and-response phrasing and melodic embellishments.
  • Understand the rhythmic role of the guitar in Sebene, Soukous, and Rumba.
  • Learn essential picking and fretting techniques for speed and accuracy.

Learn the Styles of Iconic Congolese Guitarists

  • Study Sebene lines from Franco, Alain Makaba, Popolipo Beniko, and Roxy Tshimpaka.
  • Break down interval techniques, chromatic runs, and phrasing unique to each player.
  • Explore how these guitarists shaped the evolution of Congolese music.

Play with Authenticity and Confidence

  • Develop strong right-hand technique for fluid, high-energy playing.
  • Apply Soukous groove concepts in a full band setting.
  • Learn to create and improvise Sebene lines in different key centers.

Understand the Cultural and Historical Context

  • Trace the evolution of Congolese guitar from Rumba to modern Soukous.
  • Discover how different guitarists influenced the development of the genre.
  • Explore the connection between Congolese music and other African and Caribbean styles.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Reinvent your repertoire with iconic Congolese guitar licks, mastered to performance standard.

sample-lessons.tab_content: [aiovg_videos template="popup" tag="115"]

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor: Niwel Tsumbu

Niwel Tsumbu’s journey began in the Democratic Republic of Congo, where he crafted his first guitars using fishing line and bicycle cables. From those early days, he developed into one of the most sought-after and versatile guitarists of his generation, blending his deep roots in Congolese music with jazz, classical, and global influences.

His career has taken him across the world, performing with artists such as Buena Vista Social Club, Baaba Maal, and Natty Wailer, and collaborating with Sinéad O’Connor, Nigel Kennedy, and Michael O’Suilleabháin. More recently, Niwel played on Rhiannon Giddens’ Grammy-winning album and has toured extensively with her and Taj Mahal across the US and Canada. His latest album, Milimo, showcases his ability to bridge African tradition with contemporary expression, further cementing his reputation as a truly innovative musician.

Despite his genre-spanning career, Niwel remains deeply connected to his roots in Sebene, Soukous, and Rumba. In this course, he brings decades of experience back to where it all started—teaching the fundamental rhythms, phrasing, and techniques that define Congolese guitar.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

Congolese Guitar Evolution – Deluxe

2 hours of detailed lessons teaching you how to be an expert in the Congolese guitar styles; Soukous, Sebene and Rumba taught by the Grammy award winning virtuoso Niwel Tsumbu.

 

Interactive On-screen Notation

Learning new skills is easier with our innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, virtual fretboards, slow motion and more.

 

Niwel Tsumbu – Masterclasses

Take your Congolese guitar study even further with over 3 hours of detailed masterclasses led by Niwel Tsumbu.

 

African Backing Tracks

Put your new techniques into practice and jam over traditional African grooves so you can develop your own authentic feel and be confident playing in a variety of new styles.

 

Sebene Heaven – Ebook

The bitter-sweet paradox of Congolese Rumba. Andy Morgan’s eBook details the gripping history of the countries main musical export.

rank_math_title: Congolese Guitar Lesson %sep% Learn Sebene Guitar
rank_math_description: Learn how to play Congolese Sebene guitar styles with Niwel Tsumbu. Use notation and PDF in these detailed Soukous guitar lessons.

wp_post.post_content:
Master the Dance-Driven Grooves of Congolese Drumming

Congolese drum kit rhythms are unlike anything else. Built on relentless energy, deep syncopation, and driving polyrhythms, these grooves command the dancefloor. From the rolling drive of Cavacha and Sebene to the pulsating rhythms of Mutuashi, Kintweni, and Bikutsi, these styles are essential for drummers looking to expand their rhythmic vocabulary.

This course begins with some of the most influential rhythms in Congolese music - Cavacha, Sebene, and Zouk - before taking you deep into the traditional village grooves of Zebola, Mutuashi, Kintweni, and Agwaya. You'll not only learn how to replicate these rhythms but also how to develop an authentic African feel, control dynamics, and confidently lock in with a full band. Led by Felix Ngindu, a drummer with deep roots in Congolese music, this course will give you the technical skill and rhythmic intuition to play these beats with authenticity and confidence.

Key Learning Outcomes

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

Build a Strong Rhythmic Foundation

  • Master essential Congolese drum kit styles, including Cavacha, Sebene, Zouk, and Mutuashi.
  • Develop stamina and control for high-energy, dance-driven grooves.
  • Strengthen coordination between hi-hat, snare, and bass drum for fluid phrasing.

Expand Your Dynamic Range and Groove Control

  • Learn how to adjust dynamics to drive the energy of a song.
  • Use hi-hat techniques, ghost notes, and rimshot variations for expressive playing.
  • Play with endurance and consistency while maintaining rhythmic precision.

Play with Authenticity in an Ensemble

  • Develop ensemble awareness and interplay with bass and percussion.
  • Learn how to fit these rhythms into a full band setting.
  • Adapt traditional percussion parts to a drum kit with authenticity.

Understand the Cultural and Musical Context

  • Trace the evolution of Congolese drumming from traditional village rhythms to modern dance music.
  • Study the influence of Congolese rhythms on other African styles like Bikutsi and Makossa.
  • Explore how legendary drummers shaped the development of these beats.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Harness ancient African rhythms to develop deep groove, unstoppable stamina, and authentic feel.

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor: Felix Ngindu

Felix Ngindu’s journey as a drummer began with Flash Musica, an informal academy where rising Congolese musicians honed their craft. His talent was quickly recognized by legendary singer and bandleader Kofi Olomide, placing him alongside some of the best musicians in the country.

His education continued under one of Congo’s greatest drummers, Dju Dju She from Victoria Eleison. As Felix’s career took him across Africa, he relocated to Cameroon, immersing himself in new musical styles before eventually settling in the UK. Now based in Liverpool, he has completed a degree in Popular Music and Production while touring globally with top Congolese musicians, including Kanda Bongo Man.

Felix brings decades of professional experience, technical mastery, and a deep connection to the roots of Congolese drumming. His teaching combines precision, feel, and cultural insight, making this course an invaluable resource for drummers looking to expand their skills.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

Congolese Drum Kit Rhythms - Deluxe

2.5 hours of detailed lessons teaching you to be proficient in every single rhythm you require to play Congolese drum kit at a professional level.

 

Interactive On-screen Notation

Learning new skills is easier with our innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, looping, slow motion and more.

 

Felix Ngindu – Masterclass

Take your study further and watch Felix’s masterclass and find out how to apply his principles into your own musical development.

 

African Backing Tracks

Put your new techniques into practice and jam over traditional African grooves so you can develop your own authentic feel and be confident playing in a variety of new styles.

 

Sebene Heaven – Ebook

The bitter-sweet paradox of Congolese Rumba. Andy Morgan’s eBook details the gripping history of the countries main musical export.

rank_math_description: Learn Congolese Sebene drumming, Soukous and play the Afro-Caribbean rhythm Zouk in online African drum kit lessons with Felix Ngindu.
