wp_post.post_content:
Master the Rhythms That Define Central African Guitar

The sound of Central African guitar is unmistakable—fluid, intricate, and deeply expressive. It’s the lifeblood of Congolese Rumba, Soukous, and Sebene, styles that have influenced musicians across Africa and beyond. From the hypnotic grooves of Franco Luambo Makiadi to the electrifying riffs of Dr Nico, these guitar styles are built on a foundation of rhythmic mastery, melodic creativity, and a groove so infectious, it’s impossible to ignore.

This course takes you deep inside the rhythms and techniques that shaped Central African music. Led by Kinshasa-born guitarist Jeannot Bel, you’ll develop the coordination, phrasing, and feel necessary to play these styles authentically. Whether it’s the rolling triplets of Sebene, the call-and-response melodies of Rumba Odemba, or the pulsing grooves of Makossa and Zouk, you’ll gain the skills to play like the masters while making the style your own.

This isn’t just about learning licks—it’s about understanding the culture, the movement, and the rhythmic energy that makes Central African guitar so powerful. If you’re ready to transform your playing, this course will give you the tools, the knowledge, and the groove.

Key Learning Outcomes

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

Develop a Strong Rhythmic Foundation

  • Understand Makossa, Sebene, Rumba, and Zouk rhythms.
  • Learn to lock in with the rhythm section for a tight groove.
  • Master African triplet phrasing for authentic feel.

Expand Your Chordal and Harmonic Skills

  • Explore Trois Temps, Quatre Temps, and Sept Sept chord progressions.
  • Apply interval-based lead guitar techniques used by Franco and Dr Nico.
  • Understand the harmonic movement of Congolese Rumba and Salsa.

Play with Authenticity and Confidence

  • Develop hybrid picking techniques for fluid Sebene lead lines.
  • Master the role of rhythm guitar in a full band setting.
  • Learn to phrase melodies within the groove, adapting to different tempos and feels.

Understand the Cultural and Historical Context

  • Trace the evolution of Central African guitar from its roots in Cuban Son to its modern-day impact.
  • Study the styles of legendary guitarists like Franco, Dr Nico, and Tabu Ley.
  • Discover how electric guitars, radio, and political change shaped the sound of the region.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Develop your Sebene, Zouk, Rumba and Makossa guitar lines to performance standard in just 30 days or your money back.

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor: Jeannot Bel

Born in Kinshasa, DR Congo, Jeannot Bel grew up immersed in the sounds of Central African music. His journey began with a homemade two-string guitar, built from a piece of wood, a tin of milk, and a bicycle cable. Determined to master the instrument, he studied the styles of local musicians and learned from his cousin, rhythm guitarist Dawa Lusamba.

Through these connections, he was able to study firsthand with pioneers like Roxy Tshimpaka, Franco, and Pepe Felly Manuaku. From a young musician sharing an acoustic guitar with friends to a respected professional, Jeannot has become a leading figure in the style. He now tours globally with Kanda Bongo Man’s band and other icons of African guitar music.

With a deep understanding of Sebene, Rumba, and modern Soukous, Jeannot bridges tradition with innovation. His expertise makes him the perfect guide to unlocking the rhythmic and melodic intricacies of Central African guitar.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

 

Central African Guitar

Join Jeannot Bel on a journey through the origins of Central African Guitar music in this 1 hour 40 minute online course. There's Soukous, Sebene, Zouk, Rumba, Kidagudagu, Mutuashe, Makossa and more styles to learn on rhythm and lead guitar.

 


Interactive On-Screen Notation

Learning new skills is easier with our innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, animated fretboard diagrams, variable tempos, and more today.

 

Masterclass

Take part in the next session live and receive immediate feedback and answers about anything Rumba music related from Jeannot Bel.

 

African Backing Tracks

Put your new techniques into practice and Jam on recordings by the World Music Method tutors over different African grooves including Soukous, Zouk and Afrobeat.

 

Sebene Heaven Part Two ebook

The bitter-sweet paradox of Congolese Rumba. Andy Morgan’s eBook details the gripping history of the countries main musical export.

rank_math_description: Take Soukous guitar lessons with Congolese guitar virtuoso Jeannot Bel who learnt from Roxy Tshimpaka and Franco. African guitar tutorials for all.
rank_math_title: Soukous Guitar Lessons %sep% African Guitar Tutorials & Sebene

wp_post.post_content:
Master the Pulse of Brazilian Guitar

Brazilian guitar isn’t just a style—it’s a conversation between rhythm, harmony, and soul. The syncopated drive of samba, the effortless elegance of bossa nova, the deep swing of choro—these aren’t just techniques, they’re traditions that have shaped generations of musicians.

In this course, acclaimed guitarist Rafael Valim breaks down the core techniques that define Brazilian guitar. You’ll go beyond the surface, mastering the rhythmic fire of samba, the harmonic richness of bossa nova, and the intricate fingerstyle phrasing that makes this music so expressive.

This isn’t about memorizing licks. It’s about developing the groove, the feel, the deep understanding that allows you to play Brazilian music with authenticity and confidence. Along the way, you’ll gain cultural insight, practical skills, and the ability to weave these techniques into your own playing—whether you’re backing a band, composing, or improvising.

If you want to expand your rhythmic vocabulary, refine your harmonic approach, and unlock the heartbeat of Brazilian music, this course is for you.

Key Learning Outcomes

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

Develop a Strong Rhythmic Foundation

  • Master the samba clave and its role in shaping Brazilian rhythm.
  • Apply right-hand strumming techniques for authentic samba and bossa nova grooves.
  • Use left-hand muting to enhance rhythmic drive and dynamic expression.

Play Essential Brazilian Guitar Styles

  • Accompany samba with moving bass lines and syncopated chords.
  • Perform bossa nova with smooth, jazz-influenced voicings and rhythmic subtlety.
  • Explore samba sub-genres, including samba de roda, partido alto, and choro.

Expand Your Harmonic & Melodic Knowledge

  • Understand Brazilian chord voicings and substitutions.
  • Apply melodic bass movement to enrich harmonic textures.
  • Learn and perform pieces by Antônio Carlos Jobim, Garoto, and Baden Powell.

Perform Brazilian Repertoire with Confidence

  • Play classic bossa nova and samba standards, such as "Wave" and "Odeon."
  • Adapt jazz standards like "Autumn Leaves" into a Brazilian groove.
  • Develop improvisational skills within Brazilian harmonic frameworks.

Understand the Cultural & Historical Context

  • Gain insight into the origins of samba and bossa nova and their social impact.
  • Explore the contributions of Brazilian guitar legends such as João Gilberto, Gilberto Gil, and Yamandu Costa.
  • Learn about the 7-string guitar tradition and its role in choro and samba.

Apply Brazilian Techniques to Your Own Music

  • Incorporate Brazilian grooves into jazz, pop, and world music settings.
  • Strengthen ensemble skills by understanding the guitar’s role in Brazilian rhythm sections.
  • Develop a personalized approach to Brazilian guitar that suits your playing style.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Blissfully absorb beautiful Brazilian chords into your guitar vocabulary and improve rapidly in just 30 days or your money back.

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor: Rafael Valim

Rafael Valim is a Brazilian guitarist, producer, and multi-instrumentalist with deep expertise in the country’s diverse musical traditions. Born in São Paulo and now based in London, he has dedicated his career to mastering and teaching the intricate techniques of samba, bossa nova, choro, and beyond.

Beyond the guitar, Valim plays cavaquinho, mandolin, pandeiro, cuica, zabumba, and many other traditional Brazilian instruments, giving him a uniquely comprehensive perspective on Brazilian rhythm and harmony. His deep knowledge and ability to fuse traditional sounds with contemporary influences make him a sought-after musician and educator.

As a performer, Valim has worked with some of the biggest names in Brazilian music, including Karametade, and is frequently called upon to lead top-tier Brazilian ensembles in London. He has performed at major venues, including Hammersmith Apollo, The O2, and Ronnie Scott’s, bringing the authentic sounds of Brazil to audiences worldwide.

In this course, Valim shares his insider knowledge of Brazilian guitar traditions, providing students with the tools to play with authenticity, groove, and confidence. Whether you're new to Brazilian music or looking to refine your technique, his guidance will deepen your connection to this rich musical heritage.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

 

Brazilian Guitar Techniques

Learn how to play Samba and Bossa Nova on guitar whilst also understanding the complex rhythms which underpin Brazilian genres in this 1 hour 15 minute course taught by Rafael Valim.

 

Interactive On-screen Notation

Learning new skills is easier with our innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, animated fretboard diagrams, variable tempos, and more today.

 

Masterclass

Receive your invitation to the next live masterclass and Q&A session and learn about the evolution of Brazilian guitar.

 

Brazilian Backing Tracks

Put your new techniques into practice and Jam on recordings by the World Music Method tutors over different Brazilian grooves.

wp_post.post_excerpt: Brazilian music is not just Samba and Bossa Nova. For any disciplined drummer ready to go deeper into an entire world of rhythms; Coco, Maracatu and the Candomblé Ijexá groove will define your technique, enhance your musicality and retune your feel by offering lifelong access to a vocabulary of ancestral percussive rhythms, transposed onto the drum kit and available in your own two hands.

wp_post.post_content:
recreate the iconic

Exotic Sounds Of Brazilian Drum Kit

Innovative. Exotic. Eccentric. Bold. There aren’t enough words in existence to describe the improvisational brilliance of Brazilian drums. It’s built out of an ever-evolving, eccentric, exotic array of percussive instruments. Over generations, they’ve been freely and easily borrowed from Africa, Europe, and Brazil’s indigenous peoples.

Perhaps you’re anxious to learn but are unable to dedicate your life to studying local musicians in the backstreet bars of Bahia, the clubs in downtown Sao Paulo and the chaotically colourful avenidas of Rio at carnival time. With vast regions and 26 states all contributing uniquely to the country’s national groove it may seem overwhelming to digest all of the rhythmic nuances and subtle techniques needed to complete your Brazilian beats repertoire.

Capturing This Unique Sound Requires Expert Guidance
wp_post.post_excerpt: Reinvent your rhythmic vocabulary and develop a natural Brazilian drum kit feel to performance standard in just 30 days or your money back.

wp_post.post_content:
Master the Groove That Defines Brazilian Music

Brazilian drumming is a force of nature—relentless, expressive, and deeply rooted in centuries of musical evolution. From the hypnotic pulse of samba to the raw power of maracatu, every beat carries the imprint of Africa, Europe, and Brazil’s indigenous traditions. The drum kit is a modern invention, but in Brazil, it’s been transformed into something unique, a percussive language that speaks across genres, from samba batucada to forró and beyond.

But mastering this sound isn’t just about technique. It’s about feel. It’s about understanding the pulse of carnival, the swing of bossa nova, and the storytelling power of rhythms that have been passed down through generations.

In this course, renowned drummer Cyro Zuzi breaks down the essential rhythms of Brazilian drumming teaching not just the mechanics, but the essence of each groove. You’ll learn how to adapt traditional percussion parts to the drum kit, build the coordination and phrasing required to play authentically, and develop a rhythmic vocabulary that will transform your playing.

Whether you’re a drummer looking to expand your rhythmic arsenal or a percussionist transitioning to the drum kit, this course will equip you with the tools to capture the essence of Brazilian groove with a depth of understanding that goes far beyond imitation.

Key Learning Outcomes

After completing this course, you will be able to:

Develop a Strong Rhythmic Foundation

  • Master the core rhythms of Brazilian drumming, including samba, bossa nova, forró, maracatu, coco, partido alto, and candomblé.
  • Develop independence and coordination to translate traditional percussion grooves onto the drum kit.
  • Understand how syncopation and swing define Brazilian drumming.

Expand Your Technical Skills

  • Adapt traditional percussion parts (surdo, caixa, repinique, agogô) to the drum kit.
  • Apply essential ride cymbal, hi-hat, and cross-stick techniques for authentic phrasing.
  • Strengthen your left-foot coordination with clave-based ostinatos.

Perform with Authenticity and Confidence

  • Learn how to phrase grooves with the correct dynamics and feel.
  • Play with the subtle volume shifts and polyrhythms that define Brazilian music.
  • Build endurance for playing high-energy carnival and dance rhythms.

Understand the Cultural and Historical Context

  • Gain insight into the African, European, and indigenous influences that shaped Brazilian rhythms.
  • Explore the role of Brazilian drumming in samba schools, jazz, and contemporary music.
  • Learn about the pioneers of Brazilian drumming and their influence on modern styles.
wp_post.post_excerpt: Master Brazilian grooves and transform your drumming with authentic swing.

sample-lessons.tab_content:
Sample Lessons

[aiovg_videos template="popup" tag="111" columns="3" show_player_title="1"]

tutor.tab_content:
Meet Your Tutor: Cyro Zuzi

Cyro Zuzi is a rhythmic chameleon. His journey started in thrash metal, but a deep dive into Brazil’s drumming traditions led him to study for five years under master drummer Douglas Las Casas. From there, he expanded into jazz, bebop, and swing—absorbing influences from around the world while always returning to his roots in samba, bossa nova, and forró.

As director of the Bish Bash Bosh percussion school, Cyro has spent years passing on the rhythmic traditions that shaped him. His expertise isn’t just in playing—it’s in breaking down the essence of a groove and making it accessible to drummers at any level.

This course is your chance to learn from a true master—someone who has spent a lifetime studying the intricacies of Brazilian rhythm and translating them into a powerful, expressive drum kit language.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

 

Brazilian Drum Kit Rhythms – Deluxe

2.5 hours of detailed lessons teaching you to be proficient in Samba, Bossa Nova, Partido Alto, Candomblé, Forró, Maracatu and all of the rhythms required to perform Brazilian drum kit at a professional level.

 

Interactive On-screen Notation

Learning new skills is easier with our innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, slow motion and more.

 

Masterclass

Take your study further with 2 hours of masterclasses where Cyro delves deep into the history of Brazilian rhythms and the evolution from percussion to drum kit.

 

Brazilian Backing Tracks

Put your new techniques into practice and jam over traditional Brazilian grooves so you can develop your own authentic feel.

rank_math_description: Learn the Brazilian drum kit styles of Samba, Bossa Nova, Forró and Pagode in online drumming lessons with São Paulo drummer Cyro Zuzi.

wp_post.post_content:
Become Fluent In African Guitar

This course is for guitarists who want to expand their rhythmic vocabulary and develop the confidence to play in real-world band situations. You’ll learn guitar parts from Nigeria, Mali, Congo, Ivory Coast, and South Africa and how to play them in time, with feel, and as part of a wider ensemble.

Through hands-on lessons from Niwel Tsumbu, you’ll study everything from Afrobeat rhythm patterns to West African pentatonic licks and Congolese alternate picking. You'll explore the melodic, harmonic, and rhythmic language of African guitar in a way that sharpens your ears, tightens your playing, and transforms your confidence.

By the end of this course, you won’t just know a few licks. You’ll know how to build a complete groove, how to support a vocalist, how to play your role in the band—and how to sound authentic doing it.

Key Learning Outcomes

By the end of this course, you will be able to:

Develop African Guitar Technique

  • Perform alternate picking techniques characteristic of Congolese styles
  • Apply fingerstyle and chord-melody techniques in the context of African guitar

Build Ensemble Skills

  • Accompany singers and instrumentalists with rhythmically accurate guitar parts
  • Adapt guitar playing to match the dynamics of a live band or ensemble

Master African Repertoire

  • Perform songs like "Malaika" using integrated chord-melody arrangements
  • Play ensemble-based parts in Coupe-Décalé, Afrobeat, and West African styles

Improvise Using African Musical Language

  • Construct original lines using African pentatonic scales
  • Create rhythmically engaging licks and phrases suited to traditional grooves

Understand Cultural and Musical Context

  • Identify the stylistic differences between genres from Congo, Nigeria, Côte d’Ivoire, Mali, and South Africa
  • Articulate the musical contributions of key African artists and genres
wp_post.post_excerpt: After a crash course in Afrobeat, Malian pentatonic styles, South African chord-melody techniques, Coupez-Decale and Soukous you’ll feel completely confident playing a variety of African grooves.

Sample Lessons

[aiovg_videos template="popup" tag="110"]

tutor.tab_content:
meet your teacher

Learn With An African Guitar Specialist

Explore the vibrant roots and invigorating rhythms of Sebene with one of its most accomplished practitioners.

Back in the day, Niwel Tsumbu was borrowing bits of fishing line and bike cable to build his guitars. Now he’s performed the world over with the likes of Buena Vista Social club, Natty Wailer and Baaba Maal. He’s recorded with Sinead O’Connor, Nigel Kennedy and Michael O’Suilleabhgin. He’s even written a symphony for the radical 20-piece Surge Orchestra.

From Irish folk to jazz, classical, rock and flamenco, Niwel’s story is one of cross-genre, cross-cultural exploration, improvisation, collaboration and integration. But with this session he’ll take you right back to the fundamental rhythms of his African roots, bedded in Soukous, Sebene and Rumba. Where it all began. Niwel is a real one-off. Don’t miss the chance to benefit from learning with this master musician.

resources.tab_content:
The Ultimate Learning Experience

 

African Ensemble Guitar

Backed by an expert rhythm section, this 1 hour 40 minute crash course begins with some of Niwel's personal favourite warm-up techniques before taking you on a trip to South Africa, Nigeria, Mali and Ivory Coast picking up some new guitar licks from each location on your journey.

 

Interactive On-Screen Notation

Our state of the art learning technology speeds up studying with innovative, interactive tools. Access on-screen notation, tablature, animated fretboards, variable tempos, and more today.

 

Masterclass

Take your learning even further by joining in on Niwel Tsumbu's next live masterclass session.

rank_math_description: Learn South African, Nigerian, Congolese Sebene, Ivorian and Malian guitar styles with online African guitar lessons taught by Niwel Tsumbu.
rank_math_title: African Guitar Lessons %sep% Afrobeat, Sebene, Coupé-Décalé
